She indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for three cycles having joined thanks to an invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.   She currently has a sewing workshop that she started years ago as a business selling clothes.  She later on decided to start making her own designs and putting them up for sale since she’s skilled at sewing.

The loan she’ll take out is to increase capital.  She will buy fabric from stores in the city of El Alto and after making them will sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her home as possible since she’s married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the health area and the training.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Aroma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AROMA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Eugenia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: agropecuarios, venta de cachivaches, taxista, tienda de barrio, pastelería, venta de verduras, venta de chuño y papa, venta de comida, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promoción que realizó la institución en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que implementó al observar la necesidad de sus vecinos por un negocio semejante en la zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aceite, arroz, fideo) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área la capacitación y el crédito de acceso fácil.
texts.en:
The “Aroma” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Focal Center.  It has 10 members led by a governing board presided over by María Eugenia.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: knick-knack sales, taxi driver, neighborhood store, pastry shop, vegetable sales, potato and dehydrated potato sales, food sales and fruit sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like María Eugenia.  She indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer having done so thanks to a promotional invitation the institution carried out in her zone.  She currently has a neighborhood store she opened when she noted the need her neighbors had for this kind of business in the zone.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy oil, rice and noodles from wholesalers in the city of La Paz and then sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family since she’s single and has a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the training and the easy access to credit.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, noodles.

loans.name: Rasel

texts.en:
Rasel lives in her own house, along with her only child. She sells a variety of products such as candies, canned goods, noodles, sugar, bottled products and coffee. For ten years her business has been smooth running, and she generates income for their daily needs. She is a hard-working and responsible person. In addition, she has the ability to pay her loans.

Rasel is applying for a loan to invest in her business. She will use it to buy more things to sell at the store, including canned goods, noodles, and sugar. She wants to be able to obtain greater income and improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more things to sell at her store, including canned goods, noodles, and sugar.

loans.name: Norte Cojata Pampa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NORTE COJATA PAMPA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Magdalena es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de fruta, venta de verduras, venta de carnicería, costura de polleras, venta de comida, tejido de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Magdalena es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promoción que realizó la institución en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace dos años a atrás con la ayuda de sus amigos, quienes le prestaron el dinero, y el concejo de su madre, quien le enseño la elaboración de comida.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y carne) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “Norte Cojata Pampa” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Focal Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board whose treasurer is María Magdalena.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: blanket weaving, fruit sales, vegetable sales, butcher shop, skirt sales, food sales and sweater knitting.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like María Magdalena.  She indicates that this is her first time with Pro Mujer having joined thanks to a promotion carried out in her zone by the institution.  She currently has a business selling food.  She makes it known that she started the business two years ago with help from friends who lent her the money.  The concept is her mother’s who taught her to cook.  
 
The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy meat and potatoes from wholesalers in the city of La Paz and then sell the food in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family since she’s married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the training.

loans.use: to buy meat and potatoes.

loans.name: Brisa Del Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BRISA DEL AMANECER”  iniciará el sexto da ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vicenta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de pernos, venta de salchipapa, venta de toallas higiénicas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, taller de costura, tejido de chompas, venta de cristalería, venta de tostado, venta de hamburguesas y rellenos, venta de detergentes .

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vicenta es integrante, ella indica que hace quince años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de rellenos; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió con un poco capital, ya que aprendió la técnica de cocina de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cocina y pollo) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las plazas de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y el crédito con facilidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Brisa del Amanecer" (Dawn Breeze) will be starting a sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the organization's regional office Centro Focal de Santiago II. The group is composed of eleven members and is run by a board of directors, of which Vicenta is the President.

The group's members are engaged in various businesses, including a hardware store, selling "salchipapa" (a dish of fried sausage and potato), selling food, a neighborhood store, a sewing workshop, knitting sweaters, selling glassware, selling toasted snacks, selling hamburgers and "rellenos" (pastries made from fried stuffed mashed potato), selling detergents. The loan will benefit these microentrepreneurs, including Vicenta.

Vicenta indicates that she has been part of Pro Mujer for 15 years, and joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling "rellenos". She explains that she began this business with a bit of capital, having learned the cooking techniques from her mother. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital, for buying a stove and chicken that she will get from the street markets of the city of La Paz. After cooking, she will sell it in the public squares in the city of El Alto. This work allows her to generate resources to support her household, as she is a widow and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Vicenta says that she likes the health services and the ease of the loan process.

loans.use: to buy a stove and chicken

loans.name: Khanh's Group

texts.en:
Khanh is 39 years old. She has two children. One of them just graduated from high school. The other one is in the 8th grade. Her husband earns his living as a driver. His income is about 5,000,000 VND per month. Khanh sells groceries, and she earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for ten years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge, in life and work, is a lack of capital to expand her grocery store. Her dream is to expand her grocery store and repair her house. This loan is one of the steps that will help her to reach this dream. Khanh is a hardworking and dynamic woman. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2004. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid it on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,554,000 VND to buy more noodles, beverages, beer, biscuits and tobacco for her grocery store. She always wants to expand her business.

Other members who are part of Khanh's group include the following:

Anh is 34 years old. She has three children. She repairs motorbikes. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to invest in her business. 
Thu is 55 years old. She has three children. She grows rice. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to raise chickens.
Hai is 34 years old. She has two children. She is a barber. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to invest in her barbershop.
Hoa is 51 years old. She has two children. She grows rice. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to grow landscape trees.
Chung is 54 years old. She has two children. She cooks food to sell. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to invest in her restaurant.
Nga is 42 years old. She has a child. She cooks food to sell. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to invest in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more noodles, beverages, beer, biscuits and tobacco for her grocery store

loans.name: Shadan's Group

texts.en:
Shadan is a member of this group from Iraq. Shadan is 26 years old and single. Her mother left the family when she was a child, and her father married another woman and left Shadan and her sisters. Now Shadan lives with her married sister. She is one of the Iraqi women that have seen a difficult life. She grew up without mother or father. 

She has good sewing skills, so she decided to start her own business in 2011. She uses her sewing skills to generate additional income and participate in meeting the financial needs of herself and her sisters. She has two years of experience with her home-based sewing business. In order to improve the quality of the services to her customers, as well as to improve her working conditions, Shadan would like to buy a new sewing machine, an air conditioner, and fabric.

Shadan has a very good reputation in her neighborhood, with her special talent and the customer service she provides. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits, so that she may be able to open a big place for her business and continue assisting her sisters with the additional income.

The story of Shadan and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona’s clients, who have been able to improve their businesses with a small business loan product.

The group preferred to have their faces altered, for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, an air conditioner, and fabric.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is married to a carpenter and she has six children. To help earning income, she operates a swine-fattening business. 

She borrowed a loan of PHP 10,000 from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase livestock feed. She plans to improve her livestock's shelter for the expansion of her business. 

Her dream is to improve the living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Nicolas Antonio

texts.es: Don Nicolás vive en casa propia  con su madre, tiene dos hijos que ya son independientes pero que le ayudan económicamente, él  es una persona muy humilde, responsable  y trabajadora, posee una pequeña tienda en su casa, tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por los buenos precios y la amabilidad con que los atiende,  don Nicolás está solicitando  un crédito para realizar compras para la tienda y mejorarla variedad de sus productos como:  granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, golosinas, refrescos, etc.  y así alcanzar mejores  ganancia y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nicolás lives with his mother in his own house.  He has two children who are independent now but who help him out economically.  He’s a very humble, responsible, hardworking person who owns a small home-based store.  He has many customers that prefer him because of the good prices and the kindness with which he treats them.  Nicolás is asking for a loan to make some purchases for the store to better stock it with products such as: basic grains, oil, sugar, snacks, soft-drinks, etc. to earn higher profits and better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Doña rosalina de 49 años de edad  vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos quienes trabajan y su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela porque sus productos son frescos y a buenos precios, con lo que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña rosalina esta solicitando un crédito para la compra frutas y verduras pro mayor para seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Rosalina, 49, lives in a house of her own with her two children who are employed and her husband who works in agriculture.  She works selling fruit and vegetables in the market located near her place of residence.  She has many customers because her products are fresh and the prices are good.  She uses what she earns to cover some of her household expenses. 

Rosalina’s asking for a loan to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale to continue in business since it’s her only source of work and to thus provide her family with better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosbell Yanira

texts.es: Doña Roobell de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos el mayor de ellos trabaja y el otro estudia y su esposo que es mecanico, es una familia muy unida, ella es  muy trabajadora tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la confección de prendas de vestir, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de trabajo que realiza, de esa manera es como logra solventar sus necesidades,  doña Roobell esta solicitando un crédito para realizar la compra de insumos para sus costuras como: hilos, agujas, variedad de telas, botones, herramientas, etc. y de esta manera  generar mejores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad económica.
texts.en:
Roobell, 40, lives in her own house with her two children.  Her oldest works and the other one attends school.  Her husband is a mechanic.  They are a very united family.  She’s very hardworking and has been working manufacturing clothing for 8 years.  She has many customers thanks to the quality of the work she does.  This is how she manages to cover her needs.  

Roobell is asking for a loan to buy sewing supplies like: thread, needles, assorted fabrics, buttons, tools, etc. to generate higher income and to have better economic status.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Tumalel

texts.en:
Tumalel is a very hardworking gentleman who is 37 years old and married to Natayuang. He is the father of three children, ages 11, 8 and 6 years old. He is a livestock trader in the Lower Melili area of Narok County, Kenya, and has been running the business for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

Tumalel has borrowed a fifth loan, in the amount of 120,000 KES, from KADET, which he intends to purchase more livestock for fattening and reselling at a gain in profit. The anticipated profits will be reinvested to boost the business as well as to farm wheat on his large piece of land. His dream for the future is to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, a 40-year-old single mother of one in Thika, earns a living for her family by selling second hand clothes. Due to limited income to fund her business, she has been unable to expand her business. This is why she decided to request a loan from KADET LTD to enable her to purchase more bales of clothes, thus expanding her customer base, which in return will increase her sales and increase her profits, too. 

With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will save for her child’s education and repay her loan. In the future, Ruth would like to continue to invest in her child’s future.

loans.use: to enable her to purchase more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married with nine children, two of whom are in school. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like charcoal, eggs, oil, vinegar, shampoo, groceries, etc., for resale.

Josephine has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like charcoal, eggs, oil, vinegar, shampoo, groceries, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Kathia Noely

texts.es:
Kathia es una joven de 22 años de edad, de carácter alegre, logro estudiar con mucho esfuerzo la carrera de Derecho y para poder ganarse el pan de cada día y poder solventar sus estudios, trabaja en una pequeña institución de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con algunos gastos de su hogar.

Kathia está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá realizar los trámites para obtener su título profesional, de esta manera  y poder seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Kathia, 22, is a cheerful young woman who managed with much effort to study Law.  In order to earn her daily bread and to pay for her studies she works in a small institution in the city.  She works about 8 hours daily and uses the fruits of her labor to help out her parents with some of the household expenses.

Kathia’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided her she will be able to pay for the paperwork involved with getting her professional degree.  In this way she’ll be able to continue striving to reach her greatest dream: to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to pay her degree fees.

loans.name: Ita Ruth

texts.es:
Ita es una mujer muy trabajadora, para poder sacar adelante a su familia adelante trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, Ita trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y ofrece productos de calidad.

Ita está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como polos, pantalones, entre otros y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su pequeño hijo”.
texts.en:
Ita’s a hardworking woman who works in a small business selling clothes to support her family.  She works about 10 hours daily and can tend to up to 15 customers per day.  She believes she’s doing well because she’s kind to customers and because she sells quality products.

Ita is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided her she will be able to buy merchandise like shirts and pants, among others, for he business to improve her income and continue striving to reach her greatest dream: to provide her little boy with a profession.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha, a 34-year-old married mother of five from Mwingi, earns a living for her family by operating a small retail shop. She has been unable to keep her shop fully stocked due to lack of investment capital. Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. Her goal is to fully stock her store, in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. 

Tabitha is requesting for a loan from KADET LTD in order to stock her shop with rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and flour. With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will be able to improve living conditions for her family and support the education of her five children. 

In the future, Tabitha plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a larger, wholesale store.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 37 years old and married, with three children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ailyn runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell.

Ailyn has been in this business for 11 years and she sells a variety of items, such as bread, soft drinks, dried fish, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ailyn would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Don Víctor un hombre de 43  años, casado, agricultor vive en el Caserío Chuimanzana, Cantón El Tablón, Sololá,  Sololá con su esposa y 6 hijos  de los cuales las más grandes son 2 mujeres que  trabajan  independientemente y los otros  4 son menores,  que estudian en la escuela de su comunidad.
Un hombre trabajador dispuesto a salir a delante con su familia trabajando fuertemente en la agricultura. Se dedica al cultivo de Cebolla, en un municipio cercano de su residencia, ya que es donde se puede cosechar mejor las  verduras y obtener buenos precios al momento de su  venta. 
El aprendió este trabajo con sus padres desde que el dejo de estudiar en la escuela el tercer año de primaria  y ahora con su esposa y sus hijos lleva 20 años cultivando este tipo de verduras para poder tener ingresos económicos y mantener a su familia.
Por la temporada del año donde el precio de algunas verduras mejoran ahora el está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para comprar semillas de cebolla y abono orgánico para luego cultivarlos, cosecharlos y poder venderlos en el mercado local y en otros departamentos.
Don Víctor sueña con remodelar su vivienda y brindarles vestuario a sus hijos con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor, 43, is married and lives in the community of Chuimanzana in El Tablón Canton, Sololá, with his wife and six children.  The oldest two are women who work on their own; the other four are minors who attend school in the community.

Víctor's a farmer and a hardworking man who's prepared to get ahead with his family by working hard in agriculture.  He makes a living growing onions in a town near his home where he can harvest his vegetables better and get good prices when it's time to sell.  He learned this job with his parents when he left school after the third year of elementary school.  Now, for 20 years he has been growing this type of vegetable with his wife and children to have more income and support his family.

Now Víctor's requesting a loan for 3,000 quetzales [GTQ] because it's the season when the prices of some vegetables improve.  He's going to buy onion seeds and organic soil amendments so he can grow, harvest, and sell his crop in the local market and in other departments.

Víctor dreams of remodeling his home and giving his children clothing so he can improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and organic soil amendments

loans.name: Winona

texts.en:
Winona works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Winona requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Winona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe  es un hombre agricultor de  47 años de edad, el está casado  y  vive en  el Caserío María Tecum Pixabaj, Sololá, Sololá.  El tiene siete  hijos de ellos cuatro varones  la cual uno trabaja independientemente, otro quien es estudiante en el nivel primario en una escuela de su comunidad y dos que trabajan juntos en el campo. Tres hijas  una de ellas también es estudiante de una carrera académica  y dos apoyan en los oficios del hogar.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando papa en una parcela que tiene  al lado de su hogar así como en otra parcela que tiene a unos kilómetros de la comunidad. Esto lo aprendió desde que el tenia 10 años trabajando con un primo en la agricultura, siendo así su principal trabajo como fuente de ingresos económicos.
El ahora cuenta con 22 años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que tiene más oportunidades para ampliar otra parcela. De este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q 3,000.00 para que pueda comprar semillas de papa y  abono químico para sembrar  y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
El sueña que en un futuro  pueda emprender un nuevo comercio con el apoyo de su familia así como poder darles los estudios académicos a sus hijos que aun estudian, todo con el fin de tener un mejor desarrollo familiar.
texts.en:
Felipe, 47, is a farmer.  He's married and lives in the community of María Tecum Pixabaj, Sololá, Sololá.  He has seven children.  Of his four sons, one works on his own, another attends an elementary school in the community, and two work together in the fields.  One of his daughters is studying an academic field and two help tend to the house.

Felipe makes a living in agriculture growing potatoes on a plot of land next to his home.  He also has another parcel a few kilometers from the community.  He learned agricultural work when he was 10 years old, working with a cousin.  This is his main job and source of income.  Currently Felipe has been growing his own crop for 22 years and sees that he has more opportunities to increase another plot of land.

Felipe's requesting a loan for 3,000 quetzales [GTQ] so he can buy potato seeds and chemical soil amendments to plant and harvest his crop and improve his income together with his family.

He dreams of setting up a new business in the future with his family's help.  He also wants to give an education to his children who are still in school so his family can make better progress.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and chemical soil amendments

loans.name: Alimahmad

texts.ru:
Алимахмад живет в районе Руми. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него большая семья, в семье их шестеро. Алимахмад доволен своей жизнью. Он занимается растениеводством. На своей земле вырашивает овощи. Круглый год у него дома свежие овощи и фрукты. 
Алимахмад запрашивает кредит на сумму 2000 долларов США, чтобы запустить новый бизнес по животноводству (купле-продажа быков). Алимахмад будет совмещать два разных вида деятельности и постарается справиться с обоими. У Алимахмад дома две дойной коровы и один теленок. Этот скот является его богатством. 
Алимахмад хочет купить пару голов крупных быков. И они будут находиться в основе его бизнеса. Он любит свою семью и стремится обеспечить свою семью лучшими условиями проживания. А мы желаем ему успеха.
texts.en: Alimahmad lives in the Rumy district.  He is 53 years old, married.  He has a large family - there are six of them in the family.  Alimahmad is happy with his life.  He is involved in agriculture.  He grows vegetables on his own land.  All year around, he has fresh vegetables and fruits at home.  Alimahmad is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 US dollars to start a new business in animal husbandry (buying and selling bulls).  Alimahmad will combine two different types of businesses and try to handle both well.  Alimahmad has two dairy cows and one calf at home.  This livestock is his wealth.  Alimahmad wants to buy a pair of large bulls.  They will be the foundation of his business.  He loves his family and strives to provide his family with the best living conditions.  And we wish him success.

loans.use: to buy bulls in order to start an animal husbandry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 37 years old, supporting a family of five people. He has been in the quarrying business for the last four years, with a monthly income of KES 60,000. 

Nelson has applied a loan of KES 30,000 with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), which he plans use to expand his workplace. 

Nelson will use the anticipated profit to educate his children to a higher level. His hope and dream is to have a better live

loans.use: to expand the workplace for his quarrying business.

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en:
Sarat, 34 years old, is married with five children, residing in a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Seim Reap province. Four of her children are still in school. 

To support the family, Sarat has been farming rice and cassava for almost 16 years. Together, they can earn about KHR 44,000 per day from her current business. 

Sarat is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

She and her fellow member are applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, Sarat is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes to produce more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Juvelin

texts.en: Juvelin is married with two children. She runs a general store in her village in order to earn a living. She has been doing this business for two years and she wants to improve her business. To achieve this, she borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional goods like rice and feed for resale. She hopes to generate more revenue to save money for the education costs of her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like rice and feed for resale.

loans.name: Shawgy

texts.en:
Shawgy is a successful client who lives in Taiz, Yemen. This 27-year-old hardworking man  has been operating a grocery store for many years. 


The recipient of two previous loans from AMB that enabled him to expand his business, Shawgy has gained valuable experience for which he thanks Kiva supporters. He is now requesting a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy more grocery items for his store. He hopes to continue increasing his profit in order to open a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for his business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 31-year-old woman from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda. 

She is seeking a loan of RWF 60,000 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village.   Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  

She is also a farmer, and she plans to reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Sanyu Development Group

texts.en:
Madinah, 40, lives in suburban Kyengera. She is widowed with four children. After the death of her husband, she was determined to work hard because she had no one else to help with the family’s support.

Since then Madina has sold fruits and vegetables like carrots, oranges, green paper and onions at the market. With this business she has been able to educate her children and buy a small piece of land. She has also been able to build a house for her family, though it’s not yet finished.

As a leading member of Sanyu Development Group Madinah is now applying for a 4,200,000 UGX loan through UGAFODE to be split among its members. With this loan she will complete construction on her family’s house. Madinah is hardworking and determined to maintain the group’s partnership with UGAFODE and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To complete construction of her family's house

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married, with five children, and four of her children go to school. She has one additional family member. 

She operates a retail shop that she rents at the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people at the market. She has been in business for four  years. She works seven days a week.   

She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of soda, sugar, rice, flour, and boxes of soap. Her major business challenges include transportation and electricity. 

She aspires to educate her children at the university level.  She resides in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, rice, flour, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 42 years old and is from Nakuru. She is married and her spouse produces some additional income for the family. Evaline has three children, ages 13, 10 and 1 year old.

She is in the business of selling green maize and fish, a business that she has been running for the past 13 years. She has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy more stock of the foodstuff she sells. Her monthly income at present is 10,000 KES.

Evaline's intention is to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children, and her hope and dream is that in the future, she will have a successful life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of green maize and fish for her food stall.

loans.name: Gertrudis Maribel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí vive la señora Gertrudis, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad que aun viven en su casa. Su esposo está desempleado, ya que desde hace mucho tiempo está mal de su salud.

Doña Gertrudis  es un ama de casa que para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y al ver que su marido no puede trabajar se dedica a la venta de pescado, ella recorre la ciudad y sus  alrededores de Montecristi ofreciendo el mejor pescado para sus clientes, trabaja cuatro días a la semana desde las 5h00 hasta las 12h00, a esa hora ella  se va a Manta para traer el mejor pescado para sus clientes, por lo general todo lo que ella trae se termina y a veces termina sus ventas antes de la hora habitual,  son  más de 12 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado para el negocio diario, está en el Banco Comunal  7 años y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. 

Su sueño es tener un local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Aníbal San Andrés meets once a fortnight in the Cantón Montecristi, home of the famous straw hats.

Gertrudis lives here, she is 43, she is married and has three adult children from this relationship who still live at home. Her husband is unemployed as he has been unwell for a long time.

Gertrudis is a house wife and, to cover the household expenses as her husband cannot work, she sells fish. She travels the city and the outskirts of Montecristi selling the best fish to her customers. She works four days a work from 5 am until 12 noon when she travels to Manta to bring the best fish to her customers. Normally she sells all her stock and sometimes she sells out before the end of her working day. She has worked in this trade for more than 12 years and has used it to support her family.

This loan is to buy fish for her business. She has been in this Communal Bank for 7 years and she likes it because the loans are a big help to her.

Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
Kanini is married with three school-going children. Kanini and her husband own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Kanini has operated a clothes-selling business for the past four years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the 30,000 KES, Kanini wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maideen Galcier

texts.en:
Maideen Galcier works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.

Maideen Galcier requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional vegetables to sell, like garlic, onions, ampalaya, and eggplant.

Maideen Galcier has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetbles to sell, like garlic, onions, ampalaya, and eggplant.

loans.name: Ndzadze

texts.en:
Ndzadze is married, with three children in school. They live at their own house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Ndzadze has operated a fruits and vegetables stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-green grocer in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mirzomuhammad

texts.ru:
Мирзомухаммаду 25 лет. Он житель города Худжанд. Мирзомухаммад живет с родителями, с женой и годовалой дочкой.  Мирзомухаммад несколько лет работал в своем, собственном продуктовом магазине. Он открыл свой магазин с трудом, так как начинал с нуля. Продуктовый магазин находился в Афган - базаре. По причине поднятие цены аренды, Мирзомухаммаду пришлось оставить многолетний труд и начать заниматься другим делом. 
Мирзомухаммад берет кредит для приобретения автомобиля, чтобы начать предоставлять услугу, такси гражданам города. У него нет другого выбора. Он является единственным кормильцем в семье. Мирзомухаммад надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mirzomuhammad is 25 years old. He lives in Khujand. Mirzomuhammad lives with his parents, his wife, and his one-year-old daughter. Mirzomuhammad has worked for several years in his own grocery store. He started from scratch, and despite the difficulty opened his own shop. His grocery store was in the  Afgan market. Due to rising rental rates, Mirzomuhammad had to leave his permanent position and begin to do other work.  

Mirzomuhammad is taking out a loan to buy a taxi. He has no other choice. He is the sole breadwinner for the family. Mirzomuhammad is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: buy a taxi.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and household consumables.

For more than six years, Jemimah has operated a cereal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of rice, beans and maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Alimurod

texts.ru:
Алимурод живет в районе Хуросон, города Кургантюбе со своей семьей. В районе Хуросон прекрасный климат и чистый воздух. Отличное место для жизни и бизнеса. Алимурод занимается животноводством, разводит скот. Он второй раз берет кредит в МДО "Хумо" для покупки бычков. Когда он брал первый кредит, он имел только двух быков и одну корову. Сейчас он имеет пять коров и трех телят. Алимуров благодарен Хумо и сайту КИВА за предоставленный заем. 
С Вашей помощью он может увеличить свои продажи на рынке и укрепить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Alimurod and his family live in the Khuroson region in the city of Kurgan-tube. Khuroson has a wonderful climate and clean air. It is a great place to live and run a business. Alimurod works in animal husbandry, breeding cattle. This is the second time he has taken out a loan with MLO Humo to buy calves. The first time he took out a loan, he only had two bulls and a cow. Now, he has five cows and three calves. Alimurod is thankful to Humo and Kiva for the loan.

With your help, he will be able to increase his sales and strengthen his business.

loans.use: buy calves

loans.name: Abdourahmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdourahmane est un jeune de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants de 17 ans et 10 ans. Il loge en centre ville ou il exerce aussi son activité de vente d'air. Il exerce ce métier depuis plus de 21ans. Etant une région ou les charrettes font le transport, il en profite pour les remplir leurs pneus qui manquent d'air. Il possède une machine à air qu'il a acheter avec ses propres moyens. Seulement là il a besoin d’un crédit de 400000F CFA pour acheter une autre machine car la demande est très forte. Il gère les besoins de ses enfants et de sa femme et commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 19h. A l'avenir il voudrait construire sa maison avec l'augmentation de ses revenus.
texts.en: Mr. Abdourahmane is a young 35-year-old married man, and the father of two children who are 17 and 10 years old. He lives in the center of town, where he also runs his air-selling business. He has practiced this trade for more than 21 years. Being a region where carts are used for transport, he makes a profit by refilling cart tires which lack air. He possesses an air machine which he bought with his own means. Only then did he have a need of a 400,000 fCFA loan to buy another machine, because the demand was very strong. He manages the needs of his children and his wife, and begins every day at 7 a.m. to finish at 7 p.m. In the future, he would like to build a house with the increase in his revenues.

loans.use: to purchase an air machine to fill cart tires.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: This time, for his 16th loan cycle from NWTF, Armando is borrowing a new loan of 25,000 PHP to buy spare parts for his tricycle. His tricycle transportation business was previously funded through NWTF, a Kiva field partner, to continue and provide him and his family with an increased income, which is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his tricycle.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Sopha, aged 38, lives in a rural village of the Dambae district, and she has two children, one of whom is still in school. Sopha has been growing cassava on four hectares of land and supplements her income by selling Khmer Noodles, while her husband is a soldier. 

Sopha has been in this business for ten years. 

This is the second microloan for Sopha and she has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loan that she completely repaid helped her relieve a financial burden and improve her livelihood. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Sopha, who is the leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is sixty years old, married and has four children. For the past ten years she has worked hard buying and selling bamboo in the Philippines.

Violeta is applying for a 13,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional bamboo to sell. She would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 47 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She has been raising pigs for thirteen years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Lina is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ermal

texts.en:
Ermal, a 28-year-old single man who lives in a main city in southeastern Albania, has owned his own carpentry shop since he turned 22. Later on, he made the business a joint venture with his father. Ermal makes almost anything, from doors and windows to furniture. 

He has been able to build a very good clientele because of the advantage that there is almost no competition in the city of his practice. Also, people in Albania still prefer to order things versus buying them because it would cause them a fortune otherwise.

Ermal wants to buy materials and some tools necessary to do the job with this loan. This will be his second loan, with the previous one having been paid off.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and some neccessary tools for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Rorn's Group

texts.en:
Rorn, 43, is married with two children, residing in a rural village located in the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Cambodia. The children are still in school. 

For the last 20 years, Rorn has been farming rice, planting cassava, and raising pigs. The current business earns her about KHR 40,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Rorn is just with VisionFund Cambodia for this cycle. Now, she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. 

As the leader, Rorn is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her farmland and more pigs to raise. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her farmland and pigs to raise.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Gavharkhon

texts.ru:
Гавхархон 56 лет. Она до не давних пор помогала мужу заниматься торговлей. Раньше Гавхархон сама занималась торговлей. Она торговала женской и мужской одеждой. Гавхархон проживает в городе Худжанд. Так как она сейчас не работает и сидит дома, пользуясь этим, Гавхар хочет работать на дому. 
Гавхархон берет заем для приобретения аппарата для прокалывания ушей и его аксессуары. Она намерена предоставлять услугу у себя дома. Ее этому делу научила мама, которая сама занималась этим видом деятельности. Гавхар трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Надеемся, в будущем ее ждет успех.
texts.en: Gavharkhon is 56 years old.  Until recently, she used to help her husband with a retail business.  Previously, Gavharkhon was involved in retail sales herself.  She sold women's and men's clothing.  Gavharkhon lives in the city of Khujand.  Because she currently does not work and stays at home, Gavharkhon wants to work at home.  Gavharkhon is requesting this loan to purchase equipment and accessories for piercing ears.  She intends to provide this service at home.  Her mother, who was involved in this business, taught her this trade.  Gavharkhon is a hardworking and honest woman.  We hope that success awaits her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and accessories for piercing ears

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with four children, two of whom go to school. There is one additional family member. The family lives in a rented house with electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent, school fees and food for the family.

For the past four years Annet has sold soft drinks and snacks in a rented kiosk at the market. She works seven days a week. Transportation and electricity are her major business challenges.

Annet has applied for a 700,000 UGX loan through MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of soda, passion fruit, oranges, cakes, donuts and cookies to sell. Her hope is to see her children educated to university level.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda, passion fruit, oranges, cakes, donuts and cookies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 49, is married and blessed with seven children. She has been a banana vendor in her village for almost five years, earning a net income of 1,200 PHP daily. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to ask for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to 12,000 PHP to purchase bananas for resale and to make plans to open a retail store in her village. She's hoping that her loan will be granted so that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase bananas for resale and make plans to open a retail store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita manages a crab production business in the village of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband goes fishing while she sells fish, shrimp and crab to earn a living. Her previous loans from GDMPC were successfully repaid and helped her to invest in her business. She borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more variety of seafood for resale. She is always working toward her great ambition of improving the living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy more variety of seafood for resale.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Luminosas  se reúne cada quince días en el  en el sitio las Palmas del Cantón Montecristi, lugar conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  13, 8  y 4 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y el siguiente en escuela y el más pequeño esta en inicial. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Ana junto al esposo se dedican a la preparación y venta de pan de almidón y tortillas acompañadas de jugos, café o sodas todo esto a preferencia de sus clientes, trabajan todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana y allí pasan todo el día ya que su negocio es en las afueras de su casa lugar donde instalan su pequeño negocio,  sus ventas son muy buenas ya que su negocio esta plena vía Portoviejo – Manta y Jipijapa, son muchas personas que pasan  por estas vías por lo cual sus ventas son muy buenas y les da lo necesario para salir adelante, llevan más de 2 años en este negocio.


Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos, es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a ella y a sus compañeras. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en: Las Luminosas communal bank meets every two weeks in Las Palmas in Montecristi canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are recognized nationally and internationally. Ana, 32, lives here. She is married and from this union she has three children, ages 13, 8, and 4. The oldest is in high school, the next in elementary school, and the youngest is in preschool. Her husband is a businessman. Together with her husband, Ana works making and selling yucca bread and tortillas along with juices, coffee, or sodas according to her customers' preference. They work every day starting very early in the morning and they spend all day there since their business is outside their house, where they have set up their small enterprise. Their sales are very good since their business is right on the route between Portoviejo and Manta and Jipijapa. Lots of people pass by on these routes, so their sales are very good and this gives them what they need to move forward. They have been in this business for more than two years. This loan is to buy supplies to prepare the food. She is the founder of the communal bank and she likes it because of the help that they give to her and her fellow bank members. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Betsy Lourdes

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Betsy, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijas de 10 y 5 años que  estudian en la escuela. Su marido es albañil.

Doña Betsy además de ser una gran madre que está atenta a las necesidades de sus hijas también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y productos de Avon (productos de belleza perfumería y accesorios de damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual ella sale tres o cuatro días a la semana y los fines de semana que es cuando más vende y más ganancias le queda, ella deja a crédito y cobra los fines de semana al mismo tiempo que va ofreciendo sus productos, lleva más de 7 años con este negocio con el cual  se gana algo que emplea en los estudios de sus hijas.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa y productos Avon. Está en el Banco Comunal 8 años y le gusta porque con  los créditos ella sale adelante. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Aníbal San Andrés meets once a fortnight in Cantón Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its traditional crafts, which are known nationally and internationally. It is famous for straw hats.

Betsy lives here, she is 26 years old, she is married and has two daughters from this relationship aged 10 and 5, who are both at school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

As well as being a great mother who is attentive to her daughters' needs, Betsy sells clothes and Avon products (beauty products, perfumes and accessories for women). She sells her products door to door, for which she goes out three to four days in the week, the weekends are when she sells the most and more income is available. She leaves products on credit and collects at the weekend as well as offering more products. She has been doing this job for 7 years and uses the earning to pay for her daughters' education.

This loan is to buy clothes and Avon products. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 8 years and she likes it because she can succeed with the help of the loans.

Her dream is to provide the best for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy clothes and Avon products.

loans.name: Fátima Livida

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Luminosas  se reúne cada quince días en el  en el sitio las Palmas del Cantón Montecristi, lugar conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. 

En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 7 y 3 años,  los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido es chofer. 

Doña Fátima es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de aretes de plata, bisutería y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  ella sale tres o cuatro días a la semana por su localidad ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que  deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad por lo cual tiene mucha clientela, lo que más vende son los perfumes ya que  son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y aretes de plata. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The Las Luminosas [Shining Stars] Communal bank meets twice a month in Las Palmas in the Montecristi Canton, an area known for its rich precolonial culture and its nationally and internationally famous handicrafts.  

This is where  30-year-old Doña Fátima and her husband live. The couple has three children, ages eleven, seven, and three. The two older children are in school and their father works as a driver. 

Doña Fátima is a stay-at-home mother who also works selling sliver earrings, costume jewelry, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). This work provides Doña Fátima with her own income and allows her to help her husband with household expenses. Doña Fátima has for seven years sold these goods door-to-door in her town three or four days a week. She sells products on credit and collects payment every eight days. Doña Fátima has gained many customers over the years and her most popular products are the high quality perfumes she sells.  

Doña Fátima will use funds from this loan to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and silver earrings. She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and is pleased that loans have helped her a great deal. 

Doña Fátima's ambition is to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and silver earrings.

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru:
Азимджон воспитанный и активный человек. Он женат на Мукаррам. У них трое совместных детей (сын и две дочки). Азимджон несколько лет работал заграницей. Он больше не хотел находиться вдали от своей семьи и вернулся на Родину. Сейчас ему необходимо устроиться на работу. У него имеется средне-специальное образование. Кроме как работать шафером или водителем ему ничего не остается делать. 
Азимджон намерен предоставлять услугу. По этой причине он берет кредит для приобретения маршрутки марки «Газель» и начать работу.
texts.en: Azimjon is a well-mannered and active person.  He is married to Mukarram.  Together, they have three children (a son and two daughters).  Azimjon spent several years working abroard.  He no longer wanted to be away from his family and returned to his homeland.  Currently, he needs to find a job.  He has a secondary-specialized education.  Besides working as a driver, he does not have anything to do.  Azimjon intends to provide a service.  This is why he is requesting this loan to purchase a shuttle bus "Gazel" and start working.

loans.use: to purchase a shuttle bus and start his transportation business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa, tiene 46 años, es madre soltera, ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura y confección en su propia casa. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha ido saliendo adelante y creciendo en su trabajo.
Ella quiere seguir dando todo de sí, y poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer e ir mejorando su taller de costura.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina de coser nueva para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir esforzándose y trabajar.
texts.en:
Rosa, 46, is a single mother. She has a small sewing and dressmaking workshop in her own house. She is a very hardworking person who has moved forward and grown her business with plenty of effort and sacrifice.

She wants to continue giving her all and putting her best effort into her business so that she can grow and improve her workshop. She is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of a new sewing machine to fulfill her clients' demand. She will then be able to continue to strive and work hard.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a 45-year-old man who is married to Bernadette, age 31. They have three children: Tommy, age 13, in 6th grade of elementary school; Melanie, age 5, in 2nd grade of elementary school; and Estefania, age 3. Mario runs a broiler business (chickens raised for consumption). He has been running the business since 2009. Mario usually buys chicks and fodder from a supplier; he needs two to four weeks to raise the chicks and then sells them to customers.

Mario intends to buy 200 chicks. He needs capital to do so; therefore, he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to 10,000,000 IDR. He plans to spend the loan on chicks and fodder and to build a new stall.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and fodder and to build a new stall.

loans.name: Belilia

texts.en:
For more than three years, Belilia has provided for the needs of her family through raising and selling pigs. She successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC which she used to invest in her pig business.

Belilia is now applying for a new loan of 10,000 PHP to buy piglets and feed. She wants to build another pigsty soon to make room for more pigs and her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Zayniddin

texts.ru: Зайниддин жизнерадостный и очень активный мужчина в возрасте 49 лет. Он женат, имеет 4-х детей. Зайниддин очень доволен, что у него есть семья, он счастливый многодетный отец. У него 3-ое дочерей и 1 сын. Старшую дочку после окончание университета Зайниддин выдал замуж, вторая дочка учится в Технологическом университете, третья дочь в этом году поступила в Медицинский Институт. А долгожданный сын учится в школе. Зайниддин работает в на государственном предприятии. Супруга Зайниддина имеет высшее медицинское образование. Она работает в районной больнице, а также делает капельницы и уколы на дому. От этого она имеет дополнительный доход в семью. Так как дети выросли, и семья больше нуждается в деньгах, она помогает своему супругу. Особенно в этом году им пришлось немножко сложно в финансовом плане, так как их третья дочь поступила в Медицинский Институт, а также нужно заплатить за учебу второй дочки за этот год. Зайниддин всегда делает все возможное, чтобы его дети ни в чем не нуждались и исполняет их желания. И сейчас в семье проблема с оплатой обучения второй дочери. Поэтому Зайниддин обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит на оплату обучения дочери. Зайниддин заранее выражает свою благодарность Арванд за финансовую поддержу.
texts.en:
Zayniddin is an energetic 49-year-old with a lust for life who is quite glad to have the family he does.  He is married with 4 kids, and is happy to have so many children.  He has 3 daughters and one son.  His first daughter married after graduating from college; his second daughter is studying at a technological university; and his third daughter has enrolled in a university which specializes in medicine.  Meanwhile, his long-awaited son, born after all his daughters, is studying in secondary school.  

Zayniddin works in a government-owned business.  His spouse has a university education in a medical field, and works at the local hospital as well as in home health, where she sets up IV-bags and performs injections.  Her work brings in much-needed money for the family; as the children have grown up, and the family's monetary needs have increased, she is a big help to Zayniddin.  In this year in particular, he has had financial difficulties due to his third daughter starting college, in addition to having to pay for his second daughter's tuition for the year.  Zayniddin always strives to do whatever possible to provide for his children and fulfill their desires; at the moment, though, it looks as if it will be difficult to pay for his second daughter's education.  Thus, Zayniddin has turned to Arvand, hoping to receive a loan to pay for her tuition, and would like to thank Arvand in advance for their financial assistance.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's tuition

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a married woman with three children, one underage and two who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and household consumables.

For more than three years, she has operated a cereal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the loan of 10,000 KES, Nadzua wants to purchase stock of rice, beans and maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Ángela Janet

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Ángela tiene 43 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tiene  tres hijos de 11, 9 y 5 años que estudian en la escuela. El marido es albañil.

Doña Ángela es una gran madre y esposa que además de estar pendiente de su hogar también se dedica al comercio, ella  vende productos de paja toquilla como sombreros, adornos entre otras cosas,  para realizar sus ventas ella viaja todas las semanas a Quito, Guayaquil y Esmeraldas  a entregar a comerciantes de estos lugares sus productos, se queda dos días en estas ciudades  hasta que le hayan cancelado lo que dejo, luego regresa a su hogar y viaja la siguiente semana a otra ciudad. Su mercadería compra a artesanos de los Bajos de Montecristi. El producto que más vende los sombreros de paja toquilla que son muy apreciados por turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más sombreros de paja toquilla para vender a sus clientes. Está en el Banco Comunal más de 8 años y le gusta por la ayuda recibida. 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es de su mamá.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Aníbal San Andrés meets once a fortnight in Cantón Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its crafts which are recognised at a National and International level. The place is famous for its straw hats.

Ángela lives here, she is 43, married and has three children aged 11, 9 and 5 from this relationship, who are all at school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Ángela is a great wife and mother who is a salesperson as well as taking care of her home. She sells straw products like hats and decorations among other things. To sell her products she travels to Quito, Guayaquil and Esmeraldas every week to deliver her products to business people in these areas. She spends two days in these cities until she has run out of products and the she returns home and travels to another city the following week. She buys her merchandise from artisans in slums. The best selling products are the straw hats that are valued by national and foreign tourists.

She will use this loan to buy more straw hats to sell to her customers. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for more than 8 years and she likes the help she received. 

Her dream is to have her own home as she currently lives in her mother's home.

loans.use: to buy straw hats.

loans.name: Alexandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Luminosas  se reúne cada quince días en el  en el sitio las Palmas del Cantón Montecristi, lugar conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. 

En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de un año de edad. El marido trabaja con ella. 

Doña Alexandra junto al esposo se dedican a la preparación y venta de dulces de varios sabores, en las tardes y noches ellos elaboran estos dulces que luego ella se encarga de vender en un pequeño puesto que instalan en las afueras de su casa o también su marido se desplaza a otras ciudades a vender o a entregar a otros comerciantes. Ella además de vender sus duces también vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), con lo cual se gana algo extra,  llevan más de 3 años en este negocio que les permite salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los dulces, es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los creditos. 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a su bebé.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Luminosas" meets every 15 days in Las Palmas, in the canton of Montecristi.  This is a place that is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are well-known both nationally and internationally.  

This is where Alexandra, 20, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage that has produced a one year-old child.  Alexandra's husband works with her.

Along with her husband, Alexandra makes and sells a variety of sweets.  In the afternoons and evenings they make the sweets, and then later on she takes them to sell from a small sales post that is set up outside their house.  Also, her husband goes to other cities to sell them and to deliver them to other retailers.  In addition to selling her sweets, Alexandra also has a business selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women) to earn a little extra income.  She's had this business for more than 3 years, and it has enabled her to get ahead.

With this loan, she will buy ingredients to make her sweets.  She is a founder of her communal bank, and she likes it because of the help that is provided with these loans.  Alexandra's dream is to provide the best for her baby.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make sweets

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry es un hombre muy trabajador, para poder sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja realizando las labores de siembra y cosecha, así como también abono de los cultivos; Henry cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y cumplido en su trabajo.

Henry está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como piedras, cemento, arena fina, entre otros, de esta manera podrá seguir construyendo su vivienda de material noble y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa de material noble y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia”.
texts.en:
Henry is a very hardworking man, in order to support his family he works as a labourer in an agricultural farm in the city. His job is to carry out the sowing and harvest as well as fertilising the crops. Henry believes that he is doing well because he is responsible and dedicated in his work.

Henry is very grateful to the kiva loan givers as, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy building materials like stones, cement, sand and others. This will allow him to continue building his home with quality materials and to keep working towards achieving his greatest dream: "To have a home built from quality materials and give his family a better quality of life".

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maysara

texts.ru: Майсара родилась в 1974 году. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. 3 года назад она поступила на работу в среднюю школу. Она работает учительницей младших классов. В тот же год она поступила в Педагогический Институт с целью повышения квалификации. Майсара данное время является студенткой 3 курса. Она учится в заочное отделение. Майсара должна оплатить за учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Maysara was born in 1974. She is a widow and has two children. Three years ago, she started working at a high school. She works as a teacher for the junior classes. The same year she entered the Pedagogical Institute, with an aim to improve her qualifications. 

Maysara is currently a third year student. She studies at the correspondence department. Maysara needs to pay for her tuition. She requests a loan in the amount of 1,000 somoni to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her education

loans.name: Monte Calvario Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MONTE CALVARIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Fabiana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ovejas, venta de queso, agricultura, venta de leche, producción de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Fabiana es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promoción que realizó la institución en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de leche que inicio hace diez años atrás al tener una oportunidad en su comunidad para la venta de este producto a una empresa lechera.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de forraje) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de comunidades aledañas a su vivienda y posteriormente lo dará a sus animales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área la capacitación de crédito.
texts.en:
The group "Monte Calvario" will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focus Center of Patacamaya, it has eight members and it's managed by a board of directors where Fabiana is the President.  The businesses that the members of the community association have vary, among them are: sheep sales, cheese sales, agriculture, milk sales, potato production.

The loan they will get will benefit micro-entrepreneurs where Fabiana is part of, she indicates that five months ago she became a member of Pro Mujer, joining as an invitation the institution gave her when they were promoting it in her area.  Currently she has a business of milk production that she started 10 years ago when she had an opportunity to sell this product in her community.

The loan that they will take out now is to increase capital (buy forage) that she will buy with wholesalers of the communities close to her residence and then she will feed to her livestock.  This working format allows her to generate resources to support her family, she is married and has two children.
 
When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, she indicates that she likes the credit training area.

loans.use: to buy forage

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Luminosas  se reúne cada quince días en el  en el sitio las Palmas del Cantón Montecristi, lugar conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. 

En este lugar vive la señorita Martha, tiene 39 años de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio.

Doña Martha junto a sus padres desde hace mas de 20 años instalaron una tienda de víveres en la localidad, la misma que a punta de esfuerzo y trabajo han logrado incrementarla y aun  mas desde que reciben los créditos, allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, además de dulces, miel de abeja y otros productos típicos de la provincia. Ella aprovecha para vender estos productos a personas que pasan por esta localidad rumbo a otras ciudades,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus padres trabajan junto a ella ya que es el negocio de la familia.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, dulces y otros víveres que vende en su local. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The "Las Luminosas" communal bank meets every fifteen days in Las Palmas del Cantón Montecristi. This area is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its artisan crafts, which are recognized nationally and internationally.

Martha, 39, lives in this area. She is single and lives in her parents' house. She has been with the communal bank since its foundation, and she enjoys it because the loans allow her to finance her business.

Martha and her parents opened a grocery store in their community twenty years ago. With their effort and work, they have managed to grow their store, especially since they have been receiving these loans. They sell all kinds of products in the store, such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, legumes, vegetables, and fruit, as well as candy, honey and other typical products from the province. She takes advantage of the opportunity to sell these products to people who are passing through the town on their way to other cities. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m., and sometimes even later. Her parents work with her, since this is their family business.

She will use this loan to stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, candy, and other goods that she sells in the store. Her goals are to continue making progress with her business and for the store to grow every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, candy, and other goods.

loans.name: Urmatkan

texts.ru: Урматкан, 41 год, вдова, имеет 3 сыновей и 2 дочерей.
