После смерти мужа, кормильца семьи в поиске доходов для своей семьи Урматкан стала заниматься торговлей продуктов питания, начав этот бизнес с 1,000 сом KGS в 1995 году. Магазин у нее арендованный, реализует продукты питания. Благодаря упорному труду Урматкан, она смогла развить и расширить свой товар, ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Урматкан расширить свой товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Урматкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку оптовых продуктов питания для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита помогут Урматкан увеличить товарооборот в продуктовом магазине, а также полученная прибыль поможет растить и обучить детей в хороших условиях.
texts.en: Urmatkan is 41 years old, a widow, and has three sons and two daughters. After her husband's death, she became the sole breadwinner for the family. Urmatkan was searching for a source of income for her family, and thereby began selling groceries. She started her business with 1,000 KGS in 1995. She rents her grocery shop. Through her hard work, Urmatkan was able to develop and expand her product line. Her business brings in about 15,000 KGS per month, which pays for all of the food and household needs of the family. The income generated by her business has allowed Urmatkan to expand her business. In order to further develop her business, Urmatkan approached the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 130,000 KGS to buy wholesale food products for resale. The income from the loan will help Urmatkan increase sales in her grocery store. The resulting profit will help her raise and educate her children well.

loans.use: to buy food for resale

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 53 years old and married, with seven children.

Marlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she requested a PHP 28,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, milk, and eggs.

Marlene has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and she also earns an income from farming, buy-and-sell vegetables, and raising livestock. Marlene aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, milk, and eggs.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La  Señora Marcelina de 49 años, vive con su mamá en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 15 años al negocio de venta de calzado y también vende ropa variada.
Doña Marcelina sus cliente son amigos y vecinos que a diario visita,  vende de forma ambulante está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de zapatos, tenis, sandalias, blusas, camisetas y pantalones siendo esta su otra actividad, quiere tener más mercadería para aprovechar la temporada de las fiestas patrias. 
Doña Marcelina espera que esta inversión le genere ganancias que le permitan mejorar un poco su situación económica, su sueño es mejorar su casa de habitación.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 49, lives with her mother in her house in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo, which is in the south of Honduras. She has sold shoes for fifteen years, and she also sells a variety of clothing.

Marcelina's clients are her friends and neighbors who she visits daily. She is a traveling saleswoman. She has applied for a loan to buy shoes, sneakers, and sandals, as well as blouses, T-shirts, and pants, since this is her other business activity. She would like to have more merchandise so that she can take advantage of the national holiday season.

Marcelina hopes that this investment will generate earnings that will allow her to improve her financial situation a little. Her dream is to improve her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2013

loans.use: to buy shoes, sneakers, sandals, blouses, T-shirts, and pants for her businesses.

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru:
Ислому 50 лет. Он проживает в районе Хамадони. Ислом гордо носит статус верного мужа и заботливого учителя. Ислом на протяжении 15 лет работает преподавателем в местной школе. Он считает что работа учителя - это его призвание, потому что он сам отец шестерых детей и знает, что для детей важно. Свободное время он старается  проводить дома рядом с семьей и присмотривать за скотом. Ислом получает удовольствие проводя время на скотном дворе. 
Ислом берет кредит для закупа дойной коровы и двух телят. Средства кредита пойдут в основном на увеличение поголовья быков. Ислом с детства любит присматривать за скотами и разводить их. Он даже работал ветеринаром. Ислом надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Islom is 50 years old. He lives in the Hamadoni region. Islom proudly holds the status of a faithful husband and caring teacher. Islom has worked as a teacher at the local school for a period of 15 years. He believes that working as a teacher is his calling, because he is a father of six children himself, and knows what is important for children. He tries to spend his free time at home, near his family, and looking after the cattle. 

Islom enjoys spending time in the cattle yard. He takes a loan to purchase a dairy cow and two calves. The income from the loan will go mainly to increase the number of bulls. Since childhood Islom loved looking after cattle and breed them. He even worked as a veterinary. Islom hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and two calves

loans.name: Juntos Para El Progreso Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS PARA EL PROGRESO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia  Alicia tiene 20 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y papa, la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajand9 para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras como zanahorias, zapallos entre otros.

Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de golosinas, venta de ropa, venta de artefactos, venta de plasticos, venta de cds, maestro contratista.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Alicia belongs to the communal bank "Juntos Para el Progreso."  This group is from the Huanchac district of Cusco province, in the department of Cusco.

Alicia is 20 years old, lives with a partner, and has a child.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling vegetables and potatoes.  She sells in one of the markets in the City of Cusco.  She's had this business for some time, and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into the business every day.  She is a responsible and hardworking person who wants to continue to work so that she can support her family.

Alicia is requesting a loan to buy vegetables such as: carrots, squash, and other produce.

The other members of this group have businesses selling: snacks, clothing, appliances, plastic items, and CDs, and one member is a building contractor.

The person in the photo whose face is covered does not belong to this communal bank.

Alicia is grateful for the support that she will be getting, and she promises to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as carrots and squash

loans.name: Las Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Unidas lleva ese nombre, ya que son todas mujeres unidas que luchan por crecer y salir adelante, es un grupo nuevo que está en su ciclo número uno, aprendiendo a trabajar juntas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde en su gran mayoría se encuentran mejorando su estilo de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ambrosia, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, y comenta que siempre motiva a sus amigas a seguir trabajando y crecer conforme a eso. Cuenta que hace empanadas, sándwich, milanesas, marineras y vende productos lácteos, también gaseosas, agua mineral entre otros, se  destaca el gran esfuerzo que ella hace ya que quiere ir mejorando y saliendo adelante.
La Sra. Ambrosia solicita de este crédito para la compra de aguas, gaseosas, milanesas, empanadas y demás para poder venderlos y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, invertir en su negocio e ir mejorando sus ingresos para seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: The Las Unidas group has this name because they are all united women who are fighting to grow and move forward. It is a new group that is on its first loan cycle, learning to work together. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, in which the majority are improving their lifestyle. One of the members is Ambrosia, who is the president of this group, and she says that because of this, she always motivates her friends to keep working and growing. She says that she makes empanadas, sandwiches, milanesas (breaded meat fillets), and marineras (meat covered in Paraguayan tortilla). She sells dairy products as well as sodas and mineral water, among other things. She emphasizes the great effort she makes since she wants to continue improving and moving forward. Ambrosia is applying for this loan to buy water, sodas, milanesas, empanadas, and other things to later sell them and this way be able to continue with her sales, invest in her business and improve her income in order to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy water, sodas, milanesas (breaded meat fillets), empanadas, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Hadisakhon

texts.ru: Хадисахон имеет высшее образование. Она вдова и имеет 3 детей. После смерти мужа она встретилась с трудностями жизни, так как у нее не было кормильца, и дети были маленькими. Вначале она выпекала булочки и продавала на местном рынке. В 2004 году она поступила на работу в ИМОН ИНТЕРНЕШНЛ и до сегодняшнего дня она работает в этой организации. Хадисахон является единственной кормилицей своих детей. Она старается, чтобы ее дети получили хорошее образование. Ее старший сын учится в Москве, а младшие учатся в лицее. Она должна оплатить за обучение своих 2 детей в лицее. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 700 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Hadisakhon has a higher education. She is a widow with three children. After her husband's death, she had a difficult time. She had no income, and her children were small. First she baked rolls and sold them at the local market. In 2004, she began working for IMON International, and to this day she is working for the organization. Hadisakhon is the sole means of support for her children. She is trying to get her children a good education. Her eldest son is studying in Moscow, and the younger two are enrolled in high school. She has to pay for the education of her two children in high school. She is asking for a loan of $700 US. She's hoping for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La  Señora Lidia de 33 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 06 años a la venta de calzado como ser tenis, sandalias, plataformas, tacos de futbol, tenis de niño, zapatos colegiales, etc.
Doña Lidia compra el calzado al por mayor y los vende a diferentes clientes que tiene del mercado y ahí mismo también tiene un puesto en el cual le llegan a buscar sus productos, vende de lunes a domingo.
Doña Lidia Esta solicitando el préstamo  para compra de tenis, sandalias, zapatos, etc. ya que quiere surtir mas su negocio y así salir a vender ya que quiere aprovechar la temporada de las fiestas patrias.
Doña Lidia su sueño es comprarse un carro para transportar su mercadería.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
Lidia is 33 years old, lives with her husband and children in their home located in a neighborhood in San Lorenzo in the southern zone of Honduras.  For the past 6 years, she has worked selling footwear such as sneakers, sandals, heels, soccer cleats, children's shoes, school shoes, etc... Lidia purchases the footwear in bulk and sells them to different clients in the market where she has a stand for people to come and purchase her products which she sells from Monday to Sunday.

Lidia is seeking the loan to purchase sneakers, sandals, shoes, etc... because she wants to increase her business supply so she can take advantage of the patriotic festival season.  Lidia's dream is to be able to purchase a car to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase sneakers, sandals, shoes, etc... for her business.

loans.name: Carmen Martha

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Luminosas se reúne cada quince días en el  en el sitio las Palmas del Cantón Montecristi, lugar conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. 

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  7 y 3 años, el mayor estudia en escuela y el más pequeño esta en inicial. Su esposo es operador de maquinarias pesadas.

Doña Carmen con la finalidad de ganarse algo por su cuenta se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos, ella todas las tardes instala un pequeño local en su casa que queda en plena vía Portoviejo Manta lugar por donde pasan  muchas personas, allí ella vende arroz con menestra, carnes y alitas de pollo asadas lo cual es la delicia de sus clientes ya que ella les pone un toque especial a sus platos lo cual le hacen muy especial, acompaña sus platos con sodas de varios sabores o jugos naturales que ella mismo prepara, empezó su negocio hace un año con el primer crédito que recibió del banco y ahora le permiten ganar algo para el bienestar de su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos, lleva un año en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Las Luminosas meet every fortnight in Las Palmas in the area of Montecristi, an area known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts which are well known on a national and international level.

Carmen lives here, she is 24, she is married and has two children from this relationship aged 7 and 3. The eldest child is at school and the youngest goes to nursery. Her husband operates heavy machinery.

Carmen, with the aim of earning something for herself, prepares and sells food. Every afternoon she sets herself up in a small shop in her home on vía Portoviejo Manta where there are many passersby. She sells rice stew, meat and roast chicken wings, which are a favourite of her customers as she adds a special touch to the dishes that make them very special. She accompanies her dishes with various fizzy drinks and fruit juices that she makes herself. She started her business a year ago with the first loan that she received from the Communal Bank and now it allows her to earn something for her family's well-being.

This loan is to buy ingredients to prepare the dishes. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for a year and likes it as it allowed her to start her business.

Her dream is to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 40 years old. She is married to a farmer and they both have two children. She has been a potato grower for the past 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use in potato production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use in potato production.

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.ru:
Виталий торгует женской обувью и одеждой. Предыдущий КИВА кредит Виталий использовал для закупки товара. Благодаря увеличению объема продаж Виталий смог получить дополнительную прибыль и оплатить взнос за колледж, где учится его старшая дочь.

Виталий продолжает увеличивать количество точек продажи своего товара. Он арендовал еще несколько торговых мест на рынке, т.о. создав рабочие места для других людей, по крайней мере на время смены сезонов, когда люди покупают больше.

Сейчас Виталий хочет закупить недорогую женскую обувь. Она очень хорошо продается. У людей нет денег на дорогую, поэтому они покупают более дешевую. Тем не менее за счет больших оборотов заработок получается хороший.
Виталий просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 20,000 гривен.
texts.en:
Vitaliy sells women's shoes and clothing. He used his previous Kiva loan to purchase goods. Thanks to the increased sales volume, Vitaliy was able to get an additional income and pay the fee to the college where his eldest daughter studies. 

Vitaliy continues to increase the number of sales points for his goods. He rented several additional selling spaces at the market. This way he created work for other people, at least in the time of change of season, when people buy more. 

Currently Vitaliy would like to purchase inexpensive women's shoes. They sell very well. People don't have money for expensive shoes, and therefore they purchase more of the inexpensive ones. Still, due to larger turnover, the earnings are good. 

Vitaliy requests a loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to purchase women's shoes for the fall season

loans.name: Denis Medardo

texts.es:
Denis, es una persona trabajadora y está acompañado, disfruta de tres hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 9, 13 y 16 años. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, tales como: maíz y frijol, asimismo  crianza de ganado, dicha actividad la desempeña desde hace 20 años, oficio que lo aprendió de sus padres y lo realiza de 6:00am a 3:00pm; hasta el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los materiales agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas; esta inversión le ayudara a adquirir los insumos agrícolas de una sola vez y así garantizar la alimentación de  su familia.
Su sueño es apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y que no les falte la alimentación.
texts.en:
Denis is a hardworking person. He is in a relationship and has three children, ages 9, 13, and 16. He makes a living growing basic grains, such as corn and beans, as well as raising livestock. He has been in this business for twenty years. He learned about this work from his parents. He works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. So far, he has not had any difficulties.

He has applied for a loan to buy farm materials, such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides. This investment will help him to buy these supplies all at the same time and thus guarantee food for his family.

His dream is to support his children in their studies and for them to never lack food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia, a married mother of four children, all of whom go to school, has one additional family member, her father.  She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family. 


Sylvia sells spare parts for both motor vehicles and motorcycles in a shop that she rents. In business for two years, she works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and insufficient capital.


Sylvia has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 600,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy oils and spare parts.  She aspires to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy more oil and spare parts

loans.name: Maria Nery

texts.es:
La  señora  María  de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposo  en su casa de habitación, ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo en zona sur de Honduras,  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de adornos de barro.
Doña María tiene sus clientes establecidos,  solo le llaman para hacerles los pedidos y se los elabora y entrega.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mas materia prima como ser barros, pintura, pinceles, moldes de adornos, etc. ya que tiene varios pedidos y necesita tener todos los materiales para poder hacer sus productos artesanales, esta está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma ya que con los prestamos que se le han dado a podido salir adelante.
Doña María espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda para mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia, su sueño de instalar un taller de alfarería.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
María, 46, lives with her husband in her house in a village of San Lorenzo, which is in the southern region of Honduras. She makes and sells clay ornaments. She has established clients who call her to place orders. She then makes and delivers the ornaments.

María has applied for a loan to buy more materials, such as clay, paint, brushes, ornament molds, etc. She has several orders to fulfill and she needs to have all of the necessary materials to make her artisan crafts. She is very happy to be working with Prisma, because the loans have allowed her to make progress.

María hopes that this investment will greatly help her to improve her quality of life and that of her family. Her dream is to open a pottery workshop.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: to buy clay, paint, brushes, ornament molds, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Timan

texts.en:
The story of Desti, daughter of Timan:

I take accounting for my study at this school since I want to learn about it deeper. After graduating, I want to be a secretary. And also making proud my parents because I can reach my high dream as a sky. My hobby that sometimes I do in my spare time after school; reading books and helping my parents. My hometown is in Jeruklegi Wetan Village, Cilacap Regency, Mid Java. It is just an ordinary village. My father has no exact job. Sometimes he works as a laborer and sometimes as a farmer.This loan can help me to continue my studies.

The distance from my house to school is around three kilometers and I go there by bus.

loans.use: To pay for education at the vocational school

loans.name: Taswiati

texts.en:
The story of Dwi, daughter of Taswiati:

I take computer and networking majors because I want to learn about up-to-date technology. I want to be a good computer expert someday, so that I can get a good job easily. My hobbies in my spare time after school are dancing, reading novels or story books. My hometown is in Tritih Lor Village, Jeruklegi Subdistrict, Cilacap Regency. The condition of my hometown is peaceful and safe. My parents work to earn money for me spiritful and never look tired. Because of their responsibility our daily needs are fulfilled. 

The distance between my house to school is about 7 kilometers, I usually go to school by bus. In this vocational school, I will learn about computers and Networking formally. I am very grateful to KIVA lenders because this funding is useful for me and my family.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Las Kantutas De Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS KANTUTAS DE FRANZ TAMAYO”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de mantas, tejido de mantas, tejido de chompas, venta de frutas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas de vicuña; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás cuando la invitaron a trabajar en una empresa textil, donde realizaba tejido y los comercializaba para exportación, es por ello pretende ampliar su capital.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana vicuña) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la empresa. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, ya que cuenta con consultorio.
texts.en:
The “Kantutas de Franz Tamayo” communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board presided over by Cristina.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: blanket making, blanket weaving, sweater knitting, fruit sales and food sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Cristina.  She indicates that she’s participated in three Pro Mujer cycles having joined thanks to an invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a business weaving vicuña wool blankets.  She started it many years ago when she was invited to work for a textile firm where she sold her textiles for export.  She now intends to expand her capital.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy vicuña wool from wholesale stores in the city of La Paz and once made will sell to the firm to order.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her home as possible since she’s in a common law relationship and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the health area because it has a medical office.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, el se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, Miguel trabaja en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y dedicación.
Miguel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará un separador de ambiente y realizara mejoras en una habitación de su hogar,de esta manera desea brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Miguel, 21, is a single man living with his parents and siblings in the city of Pisco.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.  Thanks to his effort and to his parents’   support he’s studying Business Administration. 

On his own initiative, Miguel works for a transportation firm in his city.  He works every day for about 8 hours and believes he does well because of the good way he performs his duties and because of his dedication.

Miguel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will buy a room divider and will make improvements to one of the bedrooms in his house in order to provide more security and well-being for his family.  He will be able then to continue working and striving to reach his great dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Jhork Daniel

texts.es:
Jhork es un hombre de 25 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Parcona con sus padres, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante;gracias a su esfuerzo puedo estudiar la carrera técnica de Electricidad.
Por iniciativa propia, Jhork brinda servicios como técnico electricista, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Jhork se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprar un ropero, ya que el y su familia guardan sus prendas de vestir en cajas, de esta manera dese evitar que se deterioren por la humedad e insectos, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Jhork, 25, is a single man living with his parents in the city of Parcona.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.  Thanks to his efforts he was able to study the technical career of Electricity.

On his own initiative, Jhork works as an electrician.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well because of his dedication and effort.

Jhork is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to buy a closet because he and his family currently store their clothes in boxes and this way they will be able to keep them from being damaged by the dampness and by insects and he can continue working and striving to reach his great dream of becoming a great professional.

loans.use: to buy a closet.

loans.name: Janet Aracelli

texts.es:
Janet es una mujer de 31 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Parcona,ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante, lamentablemente por falta de recursos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Janet no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación Inicial.
Por iniciativa propia, Janet trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que el va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Janet se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva,ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una cocina, la cual reemplazara a su cocina de kerosene que presenta desperfectos, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Janet, 31, is single living in the city of Parcona.  She’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all her efforts into getting ahead.  Sadly, due to the lack of resources and because she needed to start working, Janet was unable to study the career of Early Education.

On her own initiative, Janet works as a day laborer on a large agricultural estate in the city.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes she does well because of her dedication and effort.

Janet’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will buy a stove that will replace her kerosene stove that’s malfunctioning.  She will thus be able to continue working and striving to attain her great dream of studying a profession.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Marisa Isabel

texts.es:
Marisa es una mujer de 33 años,vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia;lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Marisa no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Marisa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de animales, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Marisa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara alimento balanceado para sus animales, los cuales estarán en buen estado y bien alimentados para su venta, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograra su gran sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en buen profesional.
texts.en:
Marisa, 33, is a woman living in the city of Chiclayo, Guadalupe District, with her husband and little boy.  She’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to start to work, Marisa was unable to study a professional career.

On her own initiative, Marisa works in her small business raising and selling animals.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes she does well because of her dedication and effort.

Marisa is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will buy balanced feed for her animals which will keep them in good health and well-fed to be sold.  Thus, she will be able to continue working and striving to reach her great dream of seeing her son become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ronaldo Pedro

texts.es:
Ronaldo es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Ronaldo se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Agronegocios.
Por iniciativa propia, Ronaldo trabaja en una empresa agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de  8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y dedicación.
Ronaldo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá sus gastos de estudios, como pago de matricula, pensiones y materiales de estudios, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Ronaldo is a twenty-year-old single man living with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica, in the Santiago district. He is very hardworking and enthusiastic, and he dedicates all of his effort to getting ahead. Thanks to his effort and his parents' support, Ronaldo is studying for a professional degree in Agribusiness. 

By his own initiative, Ronaldo works for a local agricultural company. He works every day for approximately eight hours, and he thinks he is doing well because of his good performance and dedication.

Ronaldo is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since the help he is being afforded will allow him to cover school expenses, such as tuition, fees, and school supplies. This way he will keep working and doing his best to achieve his great dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to cover education expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
Cesar es un hombre de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Literatura.
Por iniciativa propia, cesar trabaja como mesero en un restaurante de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y trato amable.
Cesar se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará su vivienda, y que desea reforzar una habitación, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Cesar is 20 years old and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago, with his parents and siblings. He is very hardworking and enthusiastic, and dedicates all his efforts to getting on well in life. Thanks to these efforts he is now studying for a degree in literature. On his own initiative, Cesar also works as a waiter in a restaurant in his city. He works every day for approximately 8 hours, and he thinks that it is going well for him due to his dedication and friendly manner.

Cesar is very grateful to the lenders of Kiva. Thanks to their help he will improve his home, where he wishes to reinforce a bedroom. He in turn will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of being a successful professional.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Qochasaywas Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal QOCHASAYWAS; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Nisida Ruth tiene 21 años es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a la vez trabaja en una empresa privada, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gallinas para su negocio. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, restaurante, elaboración de tejidos como chompas, venta de productos de belleza, alquiler de habitaciones y venta de prendas medicadas.

Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Qochasaywas” communal bank located in Wanchaq District in Cusco Province and Department.  Nisida Ruth, 21, has a spouse and a son.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of raising small animals like chickens.  She’s been doing this for quite some time and does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business.  She raises these little animals to then sell them to customers that request them.  She also works for a private firm.  She wants to be able to continue working this way and to continue supporting her family.  She’s requesting the loan to buy chickens for her business.  She is thankful for this loan and commits to make her payments.

The other members are in the business of selling food, restaurant, knitting sweaters, selling beauty products, leasing rooms and selling medicinal items.

The members appearing in the adjacent photo asked permission to arrive late at the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Jenny Fernanda

texts.es:
Jenny con su anterior credikiva, compró un computador portátil para mejorar su microempresa y justamente logró hacerla mas productivo. Ella con su crédito dio un giro importante a su negocio, abrió un local para exhibir su inventario de mercancías, y con eso su miscelánea ha tenido una muy buena acogida en su sector.
Jenny dice a sus financiadores: “Gracias a la gente de Kiva por permitirme mejorara mi negocio. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará mercancía variada, como juguetería, artículos de tocador entre otros. Con esta inversión surtirá mucho mas y mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Jenny used her previous Kiva loan to purchase a laptop computer to improve her microbusiness, and she was indeed able to increase productivity. Her business took an important turn with the loan: she opened a shop to display her merchandise inventory, and that allowed her products to be very well received in her area.

Jenny tells her financers: “Thank you to the people of Kiva for enabling me to improve my business." She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan, which she will use to purchase assorted merchandise like toys, toiletries, and other items. This investment will allow her to stock her business much further and better.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise like toys, toiletries, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
La  Señora  María  de 52 años, vive  en su casa de habitación ubicada en un  barrio de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de pantalones, vestidos, blusas, faldas, ropa de niño entre otros.
Doña María sus cliente son amigos y vecinos que a diario le visita en su negocio ubicado en su casa y sus ventas son de lunes a domingo.
Doña María esta el préstamo para la compra de blusas, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, camisas, calzonetas, etc. ya que quiere aprovechar la temporada del día del niño para la compra de más mercadería y obtener más ganancias con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende incrementar más su mercadería. 
Doña María su sueño ampliar mas su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
María, 52, lives in her house located in a neighborhood in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  She’s been selling pants, dresses, blouses, skirts, children’s clothes, etc. for 15 years.  María’s customers are friends and neighbors who visit her business located at home daily.  Her sales are from Monday to Sunday.

María needs the loan to buy blouses, dresses, skirts, pants, shirts, underwear, etc. because she wants to take advantage of the Day of the Child season to buy more merchandise and earn higher profits.  With the loan’s support she intends to increase her merchandise.  María’s dream is to expand the business more.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August, 2013.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 47 years old and married with four children.

Dolores works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  Dolores has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Dolores aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar blusas, pantalones, ropa interior y para niño.
El credito anterior le permitio crecer en el negocio y aumentar los ingresos; es por ello que las circunstancias familiares y las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Juana is requesting another loan because she needs more working capital. This investment will help her to buy blouses, pants, undergarments, and children's clothing.

Her previous loan allowed her to grow her business and increase her income. This has improved her family circumstances and economic condition.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, undergarments, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Yonis

texts.es:
Yonis, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en el cultivo de granos básicos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los materiales agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a adquirir los insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol y obtener ingresos; su sueño es apoyar a  sus hijos en el estudio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yonis is requesting another loan because he needs more working capital to continue cultivating basic grains. This investment will help him buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, pest control, insecticides, and other products.

His previous loan helped him get agricultural supplies to cultivate corn and beans, and to get other products. His dream is to support his children's educations and to improve their home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, pest control, insecticides, and other products.

loans.name: Blanca Celina

texts.es:
Blanca, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de mas capital de trabajo para continuar con la tienda; esta inversion  le permitirá comprar  variedad de mercadería, tales como: frijoles, arroz, aceite, lácteos, embutidos, bebidas, entre otros; esta adquisición le ayudara a tener diferentes productos para brindar a su clientela, ya que por el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad. 
Su sueño es seguir mejorando su negocio por lo que es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Blanca needs a new loan because she wants more working capital to continue with the store.  This investment will make it possible for her to buy a variety of merchandise like beans, rice, oil, dairy products, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc.  This acquisition will help her have a variety of goods to offer her customers; at the moment she’s facing no difficulties.  Her dream is to continue improving her business because it’s her source of income.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is aged 36 and has three sons. Two of her sons go to school and one of them goes to college.

Her husband is a mechanic by profession and he repairs cars and tractors. In this area, most of the people use tractors for harvesting and cultivation in the field. Their house is situated in a rural area and people mostly do cultivation of different crops. They use tractors for multi-purposes and this is the reason there is a lot of demand for a tractor mechanic. Due to a lot of demand for his services, he always keeps busy troubleshooting the tractors.

He has been running this business for many years and his tools have depreciated now. Her husband wants to replace all the depreciated tools but does not have a sufficient amount because he recently constructed his house and all savings have been spent on construction. Therefore, Asia requested a loan for her husband so that he could become empowered to buy new tools for his repairing services. 

Asia is very happy after taking this loan and says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools for repairing tractors

loans.name: Nhim's Group

texts.en:
Nhim is a villager from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is a hardworking mother with two dependent children and she strives for a living via cassava farming and working for others for a fee. She has been involving in this business for ages and currently it has returned her about 11,000 KHR per day.

This is the first microloan for Nhim and her co-borrower in a group of two. This loan cycle, Nhim is seeking 500,000 KHR, whereas her co-borrower is applying for 800,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes that she can double her cassava yield and make more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is 30 years old and lives with her husband and her five children in Gaza.  They live with her husband’s family and her dream is to build a separate house.  

She has been selling clothes since 2010.  She works hard to support her husband to provide good living conditions for her children.

Samah is asking Ryada for this youth loan to buy shelves and an electric generator. This will help her to display the clothes for the clients properly and give good lighting at her shop.

Samah is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in this business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy shelves and an electric generator for her shop

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she has no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling banku, a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish paste. She usually sells her banku in Bremang (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling banku for seven years.

Ekua is married and has six children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Ekua wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. This will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty banku. In the long term, Ekua plans to reinvest future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is divorced and has 6 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, she is a successful businesswoman. She sells cooked rice and vegetable stew in Bremang (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for some years now. As the sole breadwinner in the family, she uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Akosua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of rice and vegetables, thus helping her improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: purchase increased amounts of rice and vegetables, thus helping her improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ana Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Ana, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para continuar en su negocio de la elaboración y venta de pupusas; esta inversión  le ayudara a comprar los ingredientes necesarios, tales como: tomates, repollo, aceite, quesillo, chicharrón, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le permitió aumentar sus ingresos y los invierte en los gastos básicos del hogar; con la inversión de este crédito fortaleció su negocio y mejoro su situación económica.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan to continue making and selling pupusas. This investment will help her buy the necessary ingredients such as tomatoes, cabbage, cooking oil, fresh cheese, pork rind, and other items.

Her previous loan allowed her to increase her income and invest in basic household expenses. It also strengthened her business and improved her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, cooking oil, fresh cheese, pork rind, and other items.

loans.name: Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Pyapy Mbarete está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están emocionadas por formar parte de este emprendimiento para poder ayudar a sus familias, son mujeres jefas de familia muy luchadoras, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación para poder conocer la situación de cada  una de ellas en toda la dimensión de sus vidas.
La Sra. Angelica es una de las integrantes, ella quiere emprender en la venta de artículos de primera necesidad, ve en este negocio una oportunidad para poder crecer y ayudar a su familia. Además quiere poder capacitarse para ir mejorando.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en carne, fideos, arroz, azúcar y otros, para poder emprender su negocio y seguir luchando por su familia, para poder mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The group called “Pyapy Mbarete” is in cycle #1 in the women’s committee program.  They are excited about being part of this enterprise to be able to help their families.  They are female heads of household and very hardworking.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey to get to know what each one of their situations in in every aspect of their lives.

Angélica’s one of the members.  She wants to start selling basic staple items.  She sees an opportunity for growth and to help her family in this business.  She also wants to get training so that she can start to improve.

She’s asking for this loan to buy meat, noodles, rice, sugar and others to be able to start her business and to continue fighting for her family to be able to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy meat, noodles, rice and sugar, among others.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Sr. Edgar es una persona muy trabajadora, que por medio de su trabajo esta saliendo adelante, se lo conoce por ser una persona muy luchadora, en su anterior crédito lo invirtió para poder comprar arena y asi cumplir con un pedido que tenia, y no decepcionar a sus clientes.
Hoy con su nuevo crédito que pide, quiere construir un nuevo horno de cocción de sus ladrillos. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Edgar is a very hardworking person, who by means of his work is coming out ahead. He is known for being a determined person. He invested his previous loan to be able to buy sand and so fulfill an order that he had and not disappoint his customers.

Now, with the new loan that he is requesting, he wants to construct a new cooking oven from his bricks. He is thankful for the opportunity that he is receiving which will be very helpful for him to be able to continue working.

loans.use: to construct a new cooking oven.

loans.name: Celeste Regina

texts.es: Celeste es una joven emprendedora de 22 años de edad, que ha pasado por muchos obstáculos económicos, es estudiante de la carrera de Lic. en Marketing y Publicidad. Solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulacion y postgrado en gerencia de marketing y ventas. Para Celeste es muy importante este financiamiento ya que con su titulo podrá buscar empleo y apoyar a sus padres quienes en la actualidad le están ayudando con los gastos universitarios.
texts.en:
Celeste is a young, 22-year-old enterprising woman who has overcome many economic obstacles. She is a student studying toward an undergraduate degree in Marketing and Advertising. She is requesting this loan to pay for a Marketing and Sales Management course toward her degree.

For Celeste, this financing is very important because with this degree she will seek employment and support her parents who are currently helping her cover her university expenses.

loans.use: to pay for a course toward her degree.

loans.name: Clesi

texts.es:
Clesi, de 54 años, es viuda hace varios años, tiene cinco hijos a quienes crió y educó hasta convertirlos en personas provechosas para la sociedad, ahora ella vive en su casa propia a lado de una de sus hijas. El trabajo de Clesi, consiste en la venta de diversas golosinas como galletas, caramelos, cereales, chupetines, chicles, chocolates y otros. Obtiene sus productos cada 2 días comprando en los centros comerciales de la ciudad y luego los vende al menudeo en su local de atención instalado en su vivienda, complementa sus ventas con diversas gaseosas, agua envasada, jugos envasados y otras bebidas. Lleva 7 años en este negocio el cual empezó a realizarlo luego que falleció su esposo ya que necesitaba tener algún ingreso económico con el cual solventar sus gastos y el de su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará golosinas variadas como caramelos, galletas, chicles, chocolates, gaseosas y otros productos que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Clesi, 54, has been a widow for several years; she has five children she raised and schooled until they became people who are assets to society.  Now, she lives in her own house alongside one of her daughters.  

Clesi’s work consists in selling various snacks like cookies, candy, cereal, lollipops, gum, chocolates and others.  She gets her products every two days buying them in commercial centers in the city and then reselling them at retail in her stand located at home.  She complements these sales with assorted soft-drinks, bottled water, bottled juice and other beverages.  She’s been in business 7 years; she started it when her husband died because she needed to earn income to cover her and her family’s expenses.

On this occasion she’ll ask for 2,000 soles. She’s very happy to know that she has financial support because she’ll feel more sure about making business progress.  She also commits once more to make her installment payments punctually.  She will use the amount requested to buy assorted snacks like candy, cookies, gum, chocolates, soft-drinks and other products she offers her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is 24 years old, single, and working hard to hard to help her parents.  Marlyn is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines.  Marlyn has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and farm equipment.  She has been farming rice for 24 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farm.  In the future, Marlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and farm equipment

loans.name: Jacky

texts.en:
Jacky is 48 years old and a mother of three children.  She has spent ten years in farming.  With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use in potato production.  The profits from the produce will be used to reinvest in potato farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use in potato production.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, está casado, tiene la edad de 43 años, vive con su esposa  y 4 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar unas novillas para meterla en sus potreros. El cuenta con mucho terreno para la explotación de este proyecto por lo cual está invirtiendo en la compra de mas animales. El espera poder aumentar el número de animales a su poder y poder tenerlos rápido para la venta, obteniendo así más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.  Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Rafael, 43, is married and lives with his wife and four children, who are his first priority. With this loan, he will buy some steers to put in his pastures. He has a lot of land for running this type of operation, which is why he is investing in buying more animals. He hopes to increase the number of animals he owns so he can have them ready to sell quickly. This will provide him with more income for his family's wellbeing. This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't had loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR provided him a loan with better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Kaveke

texts.en:
Kaveke is a married woman with two children.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  She has operated a retail shop for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.  She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long enough to repay loans. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a 34-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Priscilla, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with one child. 

Duncan has been farming for the past ten years. His monthly income is approximately 12,000 KES, which he uses to pay for his family's living expenses.  

Duncan is applying for his first loan from KADET. He would like to use the loan proceeds to buy livestock for his farm. With the profits he expects to generate as a result of the loan, he plans to engage in large-scale farming operations. 

In the future, Duncan hopes to be able to educate his child and to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his farm.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 31 years old and has been running a business of selling clothes. He is married to Margaret, and together they have been blessed with one child. Stephen has been selling clothes for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to meet the needs of his family. 

Stephen is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET. He will use the loan to buy more clothes, for resale at a profit. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will pay school fees for his child and repay the loan. His hope and dream is to improve on the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Njuguna

texts.en:
Njuguna is 43 years old. A shopkeeper and part-time farmer, he is married to Phyllis. They are blessed with one child. Njuguna has been running his shop for the past three years, with a monthly income of ksh 9,000 which he uses to provide for the needs of his family.  

Njuguna is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Njuguna will use the loan to buy dairy cows. With the expected profit from his farm he will expand his shop. 

His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her hamburger stand.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo, de 43 años de edad, es padre soltero de 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Segundo se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en un mototaxi que se compró con el fruto de sus ahorros, lleva en está actividad un promedio de 5 años. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Se inició por la necesidad de contar con un trabajo, ya que no podía conseguir un empleo, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad pues puede manejar su horario laboral libremente, además de ser su propio jefe. Por lo contrario comenta que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra o sufre algunos daños de manera continúa pues le ocasiona muchos gastos, pero aun así logra ver resultados positivos aunque desea mayor seguridad, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su actividad de transporte comprándose un vehículo de carga pesada ya que el pago en este tipo de transporte es mucho mayor. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado refaccionará su mototaxi comprando espejos, llantas y aro que necesita para que pueda seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Segundo, 43 years old, is a single father of four children with whom he lives in in his own home. Segundo makes a living providing passenger transportation services in a motorcycle taxi which he bought with his savings. He has worked in this job for about five years. He likes his business because it allows him to have an economic income with which he can settle his family expenses.

 He began because of the necessity of counting on a job, since he could not find employment. Now he feels that he has greater security since he can manage his work schedule freely, as well as being his own boss. On the contrary, he comments that he does not like when his motorcycle taxi fails or needs ongoing repairs since it causes him many expenses. He still is able to see positive results although he wishes for more security. Because of that he has plans to make his transportation job grow by buying a heavy-load vehicle since the pay for this type of transport is much higher.

In this opportunity he will request 1500 Nuevo Soles. He is thankful for the financial support that he will receive to be able to reach his objectives. With the amount requested he will repair his motorcycle taxi by buying mirrors, tires, and rims that he needs to be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy replacements like mirrors, tires, and rims for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en: As a married mother of six children, Merilyn works hard to support her family.  She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Merilyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.  Merilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 32 loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose Marcelo

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos, tales como: maíz y frijol; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los materiales agrícolas, como lo son; abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
Comenta don José que el crédito anterior le permitió fortalecer su negocio, ya que logro adquirir los insumos agrícolas necesarios para el cultivo.
texts.en:
Jose is requesting a new loan to continue investing in basic grain cultivation, including corn and beans. This investment will help him buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, pest control, insecticides, and other products.

Jose mentions that his previous loan strengthened his business because he was able to get the agricultural supplies necessary for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, pest control, insecticides, and other products.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Originally from Sa Ang district of Kandal provice, Sem is 54 years old and a father of four children; some of them are now still in school.  His main source of income for his family is from his bean planting business.  The main challenge for his business is the low yield due to pests.  To overcome this challenge, he is applying for a new loan.  His prior loan from Vision Fund (Kiva's partner) has enabled him to improve his lifestyle and make it better than before.  Now he is seeking a loan of 2,800,000 KHR in order to fix his water pump and buy bean seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for his farmland.  He hopes that he can gain a good yield from his crop so he can make more income to keep his children in school until college.

loans.use: to fix his water pump and buy bean seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en: Jean Baptiste is a 49-year-old man from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda.  He is seeking a loan of  RWF 60,000 to purchase rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village.  Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  He is also a mason and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business.

loans.use: to pay for low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potato chips, cooking oil, and other ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Shirlys

texts.es: Desde hace 2 años, una amiga de Shirlys la motivó para que iniciara su propio negocio, vendiendo mercancías, pues ella, su amiga,  también comercializaba productos mediante guías especializadas. Así fue que inició Shirlys su pequeño emprendimiento, vendiendo perfumería, accesorios femeninos, blusas y ropa casual en general. Sus ventas las hace hoy en día, a crédito y de contado a un a clientela fija, que poco a poco ha ido construyendo, a lo largo de su tarea comercial. Shirlys realiza su trabajo de ventas, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, y sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y referidos de estos. Su meta familiar al lado de su cónyuge, es tener su propia casa y su mayor desafío, es lograr reunir los recursos suficientes para obtenerla. En la actualidad Shirleys solicita un credikiva,primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará bolsos, perfumería y accesorios femeninos y para el hogar, con ello planea aumentar sus inventarios , para ganr un poco mas, pues Shirlys a sus 23 años tiene muchos sueños de prosperidad que muy seguro alcanzará, con la dedicación que la caracteriza y con mucho trabajo en su negocio
texts.en:
Two years ago, Shirlys's friend convinced her to start her own business selling merchandise. Her friend also sold products through specialized booklets. This is how Shirlys started her small business by selling perfume, women's accessories, blouses, and other casual clothing. She currently makes sales on credit and in cash to regular customers she gained little by little through her commercial activity. Shirlys works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and her primary customers are her neighbors, friends, and their referrals. Her and her spouse's family goal is to have their own house. Their primary challenge is to come up with sufficient resources to do so.

Shirlys is now requesting a Kiva loan, which is her first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the loan, she will buy bags, perfume, women's accessories, and home goods to increase her inventory and earn a bit more. At 23 years old, Shirlys has many dreams of prosperity that she will surely achieve with her dedication and hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy bags, perfume, women's accessories, and home goods.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is a 36-year-old, married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be highly self-motivated. 

Teresiah operates a grocery store where she sells mangoes, bananas, cabbages, and onions. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more mangoes, bananas, cabbages, and other items for resale. 

Her business goal is to own a big shop within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will live a happy and healthy life. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes, bananas, cabbages, and other items for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 28-year-old, married man. He has two children with ages one year and three years. He describes himself to be self-motivated. 

David operates a transport business where he transports customers, using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

David will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy bicycles for hire services.This will enable him earn extra income. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy bicycles for hire services

loans.name: Pleanh's Group

texts.en: Pleanh, a citizen from Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, is 61 years old and blessed with six children.  To sustain her living, she grows rice on one hectare of land and plants mango on half a hectare of land.  This business gives her about 9,300 KHR per day.  Pleanh is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) who has completely repaid her past loans, which have improved her living condition.  Moreover, she could afford to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her rice growing business.  For this new loan she is teaming up with a group of four to get a new loan from VisionFund.  As the leader of the group, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and insecticide for her farmland.   She hopes that this purchase will support her crop on time and gain high yields.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 25 years old and is married to Concolata.  They currently have no children.  He is in the business of selling clothes in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has been doing for one year.  He has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy more stock of clothes and shoes to sell.  He plans to buy a cow with the anticipated profit.  He hopes to expand his clothes business and be economically stable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joycee

texts.en: Joycee is 30 years old and lives in Compound #3 with her husband and three children; only two of her children are in school.  Her children are between the ages of 2 and 11.  She says she stopped her education in the 12th grade.  For four years now she has been selling plantains, bananas, bitter-balls, peppers, and oil in the local market, and she doesn’t have enough income to buy more stock for her business. She spends ten hours a day, six days per week selling these goods.  Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more plantains, bananas, bitter-balls, peppers, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Maurecia

texts.en: Maurecia works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Maurecia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  She has been in this business for 8 years now.  In the future, Maurecia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Irania

texts.es: Irania, de 32 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Irania consiste en hacer tortas para ponerlos a la venta. A diario ella prepara este delicioso postre para que pueda venderlos en su barrio y zonas cercanas a su casa o para cumplir con algunos pedidos que tiene, realiza esta actividad en su casa en donde tiene acondicionado un modesto taller de repostería conformado por un horno eléctrico y algunos moldes, a pesar de esto es muy responsable en su trabajo ya que siempre tiene clientes que le solicitan una determinada cantidad de kekes que posteriormente se encargan de vender en porciones personales. Realiza este trabajo hace 2 años y en este tiempo a obtenido la suficiente experiencia para conocer el gusto de sus clientes. Complementa su labor con la venta de perfumes, talcos y otros productos cosméticos. Tiene muchos planes a futuro pero lo que mas desea es tener un taller mas grande e implementado en donde pueda tener mayor producción. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 500, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad, ella por su parte se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes e insumos como harina, leche, huevos, mantequillas y otros productos que necesita para preparar sus postres.
texts.en:
Irania, 32, is married with two children living with her in her own house.  Irania’s work consists in making cakes and putting them up for sale.  She prepares this delicious dessert daily to sell in her neighborhood and in zones near her house or to fill orders she gets.  She does this activity at home where she’s set up a modest pastry workshop consisting of an electric oven and some cake molds.  Despite this, her she’s very responsible with her work because she always has customers ordering specific numbers of cakes who then resell them in individual portions.  She’s been doing this work for two years and has gained sufficient experience in this time to know her customers’ taste.  She complements this work with perfume, talc and cosmetics sales.  She has many future plans but what she most wants is to have a larger, well-equipped workshop so that she can increase production.

On this occasion she’s going to request 500 soles.  She’s very happy to know that she’s going to have financial support that will guarantee her being able to continue to work with peace of mind.  On her part, she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the amount requested to buy supplies and ingredients like flour, milk, eggs, butter and other products needed to make her desserts.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, eggs, milk, butter, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Lostenia

texts.es:
Gloria, le surge la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar maíz y láminas para construir su espacio para mejorar el negocio.
El crédito anterior le ayudo mejorar sus ingresos y con ello ha logrado incrementar la clientela. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en: Gloria needs to get another loan because she needs more working capital to continue in her business making and selling tortillas.  This investment will help her buy corn and metal sheeting to build space to improve the business.  Her previous loan helped her to improve her income and she’s increased her clientele too.  Her economic conditions and family circumstances have optimized.

loans.use: to buy corn and metal sheeting..

loans.name: Jose Reyneri

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en el cultivo de granos básicos, tales como: maíz y frijol; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los materiales agrícolas, abono, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los insumos agrícolas para el cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos; su sueño es apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en: José needs to get a new loan because he needs more working capital to continue growing basic grains like corn and beans.  This investment will help him buy agricultural supplies like manure, pesticide, fungicide, insecticide and others.
