texts.es: Doña rosa vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, para luego salir a comercializarlo a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  doña rosa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para seguir con su siembra y tener una mejor calidad de vida con su esposo.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa lives in her own home with her husband.  She has been farming for several years.  Her main crops are corn and beans.  When her harvest is ready, the crops are stored in a granary, as shown in the photograph.  Later on, she sells the crops at different markets near her home.  With the revenue she generates from her sales, she is able to help her husband with some of the household expenses.

Doña Rosa is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies so that she can continue planting and have a better quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies.

loans.name: Estelvina

texts.es:
La Sra. Estelvina tiene 44 años, está casada, vive en la ciudad de Caacupé, es una comerciante muy trabajadora, y comenta que tiene una peluquería.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que sabe que por medio de su trabajo es la única forma de salir adelante, y es por ello que está luchando por salir adelante, mejorar cada día más y tener un mayor número de clientes.
El crédito será invertido en la compra de una silla giratoria y un lavadero de cabello para poder brindar mejor servicio a su clientela. Está muy contenta por la oportunidad que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sra. Estelvina is 44 years old, married, and lives in the city of Caacupé.  She is a hardworking merchant who says that she manages a beauty salon.  

Estelvina is a very industrious person, so she knows that work is the only way to get ahead.  For this reason, she strives to move forward and improve each day.  She has a large number of clients.  

Her loan will be invested in the purchase of a swivel chair and a shampoo station so that she can provide better service to her clients.  She is very pleased with the opportunity she has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy a swivel chair and a shampoo station.

loans.name: Yessica Paola

texts.es:
Yessica tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha, la cual se caracteriza por su clima variado y sus playas hermosas, Yessica para poder salir adelante y solventar sus gastos trabaja como personal de limpieza en una institución de su ciudad, Yessica cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque su motor para salir adelante es su hijo.

Yessica está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar materiales para mejorar el cuarto de su pequeño hijo, ya que actualmente se encuentra en malas condiciones, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y poder seguir trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño: “Darle una profesión a su hijo y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Yessica is 25 years old and lives in the city of Chincha, which is known for its changing climate and its beautiful beaches.  In order to get ahead and cover her expenses, Yessica works as part of the cleaning staff at an institution in the city.  She believes she is moving forward because she is very responsible.  Most of all, her son gives her the motivation to press forward.  

Yessica is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their support, she will be able to buy materials for improving her young son’s room which is currently in bad condition.  This will help improve her son’s quality of life.  Yessica continues to work and strive toward fulfilling her greatest wish of helping her son pursue a profession and having a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for remodeling her son's room.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is married with two school going children. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Charity has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future. With the Kshs 10,000, Charity wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: Doña Maria, tiene 61 años de edad,  es madre soltera, vive con un nieto en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida.  Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, inicio vendiendo ropa y zapatos. Hace un año decidió por comprar, engordar y vender cerdos, pero también destaza y vende la carne por libras. ha solicitado un segundo préstamo en la institución el cual es por 6,000 Lempiras, ella va comprar cerdos para engorde y vender. Espera que esta inversión le ayude a incrementar los ingresos. Su plan es ayudar  a su nieto a que termine sus  estudios.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 61 years old and a single mother.  She lives with her grandson in the town of Masica, Atlántida.  

Maria has always engaged in the retail trade.  She started out selling clothing and shoes.  A year ago she decided to buy, fatten, and sell pigs.  She also butchers them and sells the meat by the pound.  Maria is requesting her second loan from ODEF in the amount of 6,000 HNL.  She will buy pigs to fatten and sell.  Maria hopes that this investment will help increase her earnings.  Her plan is to help her grandson finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Aline

texts.en: Aline is a 27-year-old woman from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of RWF 60,000  to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which she will then resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business.

loans.use: to pay for 20 low-cost LED lights for resale to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en:
A 45-year-old mother of five children, Seng resides in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. Three of her five children are still in school. To support her living, she and her husband have been farming rice on three-hectares of farmland. Together, they can earn about KHR20,000 per day from this current business and can save about KHR10,000 each day for their future needs.  
This is the fourth loan for Seng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Seng has completely paid back her past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a 43-year-old man from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of  RWF 60,000 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will then resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him and have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business.

loans.use: to pay for 20 low-cost LED lights for resale to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en: Nary is 35 years old and widowed. She lives with her six children in a rural village of the Moungkul Borey district of Cambodia. To earn a living, she has been farming rice while her husband works as a paid worker in local area to earn additional income for his family. Her current business earns her about 25,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. This is the second loan for Nary with VisionFund. She has completely paid back her first loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Nary wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, chicken, seasonings, oil, and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room for his sister.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Jacques

texts.en: Jacques is a 48-year-old man from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of  RWF 60,000 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. He is also a mason and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is 36 years old. He is married with four children. He has been a potato farmer for the past five years. He has requested a loan to buy more fertilizer and quality potato seeds. With the profits from the produce, he wants to add to his savings to provide his family a better future.  

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and potato seeds

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is single with one child who is in school. She has no additional family members. She operates a beauty salon from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 5 years. She works seven days a week.  She has applied for a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDTSACCO to buy hair treatment, weaves, relaxers and braids. Her major business challenges include lack of electricity which hinders her business operations. She is working hard to secure a permanent business premises.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent, school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more hair treatment, weaves,relaxers and braids for her salon

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Sophal, 47, has three children in total, one of whom is still in school. Sophal and her husband have grown cassava for twenty years to make their living. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s need. 
Sophal has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has completely paid back her past loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and also hope to have a higher yield to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with two children. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Grace has operated a clothes selling business for the past two years. She sells used clothes from door to door, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Melchiol

texts.en: Melchiol is a 51 year old man from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of  RWF 60,000 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is a 43-year-old man from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of  RWF 60,000 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. He is also a mason and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 35 years old. She is the mother of one child aged 17. She has been running a potato business for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the produce will be used to reinvest in a similar business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during potato production

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат из города Турсунзаде. Ей 55 лет. Рохат не жалея сил и времени, всегда старалась для благо семьи, своих детей. Она одна воспитывала детей. Рохат зарабатывала детям на хлеб, продавая горючее на дороге. Рохат пережила тяжелое время. Под солнцем жарким летом, в зной холодной зимой, сидела и продавала топливо. Она уже несколько лет занимается торговлей. Вот таким образом Рохат вырастила двоих сыновей. Сейчас ее сыновьям по 34 и 32 года. Рохат живет с сыновьями. Ее сыновья работают фермерами. Они благодарят свою мать за жизнь, за заботу, за уют. Рохат продолжает свою деятельность. Она берет кредит для приобретения топлива с целью увеличить оборот. Она ждет от Вас помощи.
texts.en:
Rohat, age 55, is from the city of Tursunzoda.  Sparing no time or effort, she has always worked very hard for the well-being of her family and her children.  

Rohat has raised her children alone, earning a living for them by selling fuel along the road.  She has experienced difficult times, sitting and selling fuel in the hottest days of summer and in the fierce cold of winter.  

Rohat has been involved in this type of business for several years now, and these are the conditions under which she has raised her sons.  Her sons are now 34 and 32 years old and they live with her, working as farmers.  They thank their mother for the life she has given them, and for all the attention and comfort she has provided.  

Rohat is still working.  She is taking a loan to buy fuel to increase her turnover.  She is awaiting your support.

loans.use: to buy and sell gasoline along the road.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman, and she has one child who goes to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest  monthly expense is food.

Purity operates a fruit and vegetable stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 37-year-old woman from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of 60,000 RWF to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people in her village who have no electricity. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.  Grace is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business.

loans.use: to buy 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 45 years old. He has spent the past 20 years as a potato grower. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds to use in the potato production. Felicien plans to use the profits for renovating his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 per cent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 per cent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 per cent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds to use in the potato production

loans.name: Kunthy's Group

texts.en:
Kunthy, 46, is married with three children, residing in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. Her children are all still small. 

For the past 20 years, she has been raising pigs and distilling alcohol as the primary sources of income for her family. The current business earns her about 44,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Kunthy’s group consists of five members who live in the same village and she has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pig feed for nourishing the pigs and also to buy materials to support her current business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her pig raising business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for nourishing the pigs and also to buy materials to support her current business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Siphan's Group

texts.en:
Siphan is aged 52 years and widowed with four dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. 

Siphan earns a living through farming rice and selling snacks in the village. Siphan can earn about KHR 22,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.

Siphan has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loan. She successfully used the loans to better her living conditions. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Siphan will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farm and use a portion of it to buy materials for making snacks. She hopes to make more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm and to buy materials for making snacks

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: María José

texts.es: La señora María durante 28 años impartió clases de educación primaria, es soltera  con una hija con la cual habita en su  casa, durante su hija alcanzo la mayoría de edad dio inicio a la creación de una pequeña pulpería la cual fue con fondo de ahorro de salario propio de ella,  de la cual  tiene 4 años, hoy en día doña María esta jubilada y se está entregando    por entero a la actividad comercial , doña Maria se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un pequeño financiamiento para sastifacer la demanda de sus cliente, este financiamiento lo utilizara para la compra de Arroz, Trigo, Frijol, Azúcar, Semolina, Aceite, Jabón, Gaseosas, Ace, Recargas Claro y Movistar, Marucha, Papel Scott y Nevax. lo nque vendra a incrementar sus ingresos para su familia y de esta manera le dara mayor estabilidad a su hogar
texts.en:
María worked as an elementary school teacher for 28 years.  She is single and has a daughter who lives with her.  When her daughter became an adult, María established a small grocery store with the savings she had from her salary.  That was four years ago.  Now María is retired from her teaching job and dedicates her full time to the business.

In order to satisfy customer demand, María is requesting a small loan through Ceprodel to buy rice, wheat, beans, sugar, semolina, oil, soap, sodas, hygiene products and cell phone recharges.  This will increase her income and give her household more stability.

loans.use: To buy rice, wheat, beans, sugar, semolina, oil, soap, sodas, hygiene products and cell phone recharges.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is a 56-year-old man from the Muhanga district in the Southern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of RWF 600,000 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights that he will resell to people in his village without electricity. 

Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Ángel Miguel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive el señor Ángel, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. Su mujer es comerciante.

Don Ángel tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  junto a su mujer se dedican a vender toda clase de víveres, granos, legumbres, carnes, embutidos, bebidas, entre otras cosas, además su mujer también vende sabanas, cortinas y toldos, ella sale a recorrer y  también vende en su casa,  ellos trabajan todos los días  y casi todo el día sobre todo los fines de semana que es cuando más venden, lleva tres años con su negocio el cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar  más  víveres y sodas para mejorar su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 1 año  y le gusta porque con los créditos puede surtir más su  negocio.

Su sueño es seguir adelante por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "María Inmaculada" meets every 15 days in the parish of La Sequita in Montecristi, a place known both nationally and internationally for its famous straw hat.

This is where Ángel, 23, lives with his common-law wife and three-year-old son.  His wife is a merchant.

Ángel runs a grocery store at home where he and his wife sell all kinds of groceries, grains, pulses, meat, sausages, beverages and other items.  His wife also sells sheets, curtains and blinds as a street vendor and from home.  They work all day and almost every day, including weekends which is when they register the highest sales volume.  He has been in business for three years which has allowed him to support the family.

This loan will be used to buy more groceries and sodas to improve business.  Ángel has been in the group for over a year and he likes it because the loans allow him to stock more merchandise.

His goal is to continue working for his family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy groceries and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace water pipes.

loans.name: Elena Filadelfia De La Cruz

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Elena tiene  63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos pero dos fallecieron los 4 restantes ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Elena para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, ella compra tanto los pollos como a los chanchos cuando aun están pequeños, los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa. Lleva en esta actividad más de 40 años y gracias a  esto nunca les ha faltado el pan diario en su mesa cuando su marido no ha tenido trabajo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimentos y medicinas tanto para pollos y chanchos. Ella está desde el inicio en el  Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan con los créditos. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "María Inmaculada" meets every 15 days in the parish of La Sequita in Montecristi, a place known both nationally and internationally for its famous straw hat.

This is where Elena, 63, lives.  She is married and had six children, two of whom passed away and the other four are grown up and live independently.  Her husband is a farmer.

In order to help her husband with the household expenses, Elena raises pigs and chickens which she buys when they are young.  She fattens them for three or four months and then sells them to merchants who visit her home.  She has been in business for 40 years and, thanks to her work, there has always been food on her table even when her husband was out of work.

This loan will be used to buy feed and medicines for the chickens and pigs.  She has been in the communal bank since its beginnings and likes the support she receives through the loans.

Her goal is for her and her family to stay healthy and continue working.

loans.use: To buy feed and medicine for her chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Cinthia Silvana

texts.es:
Cinthia es una joven de 25 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisco. Cinthia para poder salir adelante trabaja como empleada en una institución de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Cinthia está muy agradecida con el apoyo brindado por los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar mercadería como pantalones, polos, entre otros lo que le permitirá mejorar la atención a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una boutique”.
texts.en:
Cinthia, 25, lives in the city of Pisco.  She earns a living working eight hours a day at an institution in her city.  She also has a small business selling clothing to make extra money to cover household expenses.

Cinthia is very grateful for the support from Kiva lenders because thanks to them she will be able to buy merchandise such as pants, polo shirts, etc. to provide better customer service and increase her income.  This will allow her to continue working and striving toward her goal of "Having a boutique".

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Wilmer Jonathan

texts.es:
El joven  Wilmer Jonathan  de 27  años de edad, vive con su esposa  no tiene hijos  que dependen de él, vive  en una  comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras,   tiene casa propia  y se  dedica desde hace 04  años  a la venta  de pescado, pollo, menudo y embutidos.
Wilmer Jonathan tiene su negocio en un mercado San Lorenzo, sus clientes son  los amigos, vecinos y personas que a diario le visitan en su negocio, es un joven emprendedor con deseos de seguir trabajando y luchando para darle una mejor vida a su familia es un gran ejemplo de valor y dedicación.
Wilmer Jonathan está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de pescado como babosa, curvina, curiles, pollo, mortadela, jamón, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito quiere surtir más su negocio, está contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma es su tercer préstamo que solicita.
Wilmer Jonathan su sueño es mejorar más su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Wilmer Jonathan is 27 years old and lives with his wife.  He doesn’t have any children and he lives in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  He has a house of his own and has been selling fish, chicken, menudo, and sausages for four years.

Wilmer Jonathan has his business in a San Lorenz market and his customers are his friends, neighbors, and persons who visit his business daily.  He is a young entrepreneur with a desire to continue working to provide a better life for his family.  He is a great example of courage and dedication.

Wilmer Jonathan is asking for a loan to buy fish, chicken, mortadela, ham, etc.  This loan will allow him to stock his business and he is happy to be able to continue working with Prisma.  This will be his third loan.

Wilmer Jonathan’s dream is to improve his business some more.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2013

loans.use: to buy fish and chicken.

loans.name: Digna Emerita

texts.es:
Doña Digna,  tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos con los cuales vive en el Municipio de la Másica, San Juan Pueblo.
Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida que ella misma prepara como ser, pastelitos rellenos de arroz y carne, baleadas, tajadas con carne molida, refrescos, golosinas. El local donde vende esta instalado a la par de una escuela, donde le va muy bien porque las ventas las hace a diario.
Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo que es por 12,000 lempiras para poder invertir en surtir el  negocio con productos que necesita para elaborar las comidas como ser, condimentos, carnes, harina de maíz y de trigo, refrescos, churros y dulces, también con una parte va comprar ropa vender y obtener otros ingresos. su objetivo es seguir trabajando para  darle a sus hijos la educación y alimentación necesaria.
texts.en:
Digna, 44, is a single mother with three children and lives in the town of Másica, San Juan Pueblo.  For four years she has been selling food that she makes herself, such as meat and rice pies, tortillas, ground beef pies, soft drinks and sweets.  The stall she has is next to a school so sales are high on a daily basis.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 HNL to stock her business with the items she needs for her food products such as seasonings, meat, corn flour, wheat flour and pastries.  She will also buy clothing to sell to earn extra income.  Her goal is to continue working so she can give her children the education and food they need.

loans.use: To buy supplies (meat, seasonings, flour, soft drinks, and pastries) for her food stall, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия живет в городе Дрогобыч, Западная Украина. Ей 39 лет. Она работает на одном из местных курортов заведующей производстом. Наталия – инвалид третьей группы, получает инвалидную пенсию, но, к сожалению, она – мизерная. Наталия живет в двухкомнатной квартире. Из-за того, что квартира плохо отапливается, в ней постоянно ощущается какая-то сырость. 
Наталия давно мечтала сделать индивидуальное отопление в квартире, чтобы наконец-то перестать мерзнуть в холодное время года. Для этого ей необходимы дополнительные средства в размере 16 000 гривен, потому что зарплаты и пенсии никак не хватает на то, чтобы это осуществить своими силами.
texts.en:
Nataliya lives in the city of Drogobych in western Ukraine.  She is 39 years old and works one of the local resorts as a director of operations.  She is a person with disability (Category III) and receives a disability pension which, unfortunately, is very small.  She lives in a one-bedroom apartment which is poorly heated and constantly feels "damp".

For a long time now, Nataliya has been dreaming about installing an individual heating system in her apartment, so that she will finally stop feeling like she is freezing during the cold season.  But to do so, she needs an additional 16,000 hryvnia, because her income and her pension are far from sufficient to cover those costs.

loans.use: to install a good heating system.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika, de 33 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Erika consiste en la venta de pescado fresco, esta labor lo realiza personalmente de manera diaria en su puesto de ventas ubicado en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad. Lleva en este negocio más de 10 años y los ingresos económicos que le produce son muy beneficiosos ya que en muchas oportunidades a logrado triplicar su inversión inicial. Le gusta mucho lo que hace por que adora estar en contacto con los clientes, ya que en el mercado conoce a muchas personas con quienes logra enlazar una buena amistad o relación laboral. Erika es una mujer que contribuye a la conservación de las especies, es por ello que no le agrada ver que otros vendedores ofrecen a la venta especies no permitidas y de pequeños tamaños que no han realizado su etapa de reproducción. Espera seguir trabajando de la misma forma y continuar mejorando su economía. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado comprará gran cantidad de pescados de las especies de mayor demanda.
texts.en: Erika is 33 years old and is the single mother of three children.  She owns her own home and sells fresh fish and does this every day from her stall in a popular market in her community.  She’s been doing this for more than 10 years and her income provides her with many opportunities.  She has managed to triple her initial investment.  She likes what she does very much because it allows her to stay in contact with her customers, and she knows many people and has made many friends or business relationships.  Erika is a woman who contributes to species conservation and she doesn’t like seeing other merchants selling prohibited species of fish, or small fish who have not yet reproduced.  She wants to continue working in the same manner and continuing to improve her finances.  She is asking for a loan of S/1,000 and she is grateful to those who make it possible for her to continue her goals.  She will use the money to buy large quantities of the species of highest demand.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty habite  dans le même quartier ou se situe le Guichet. Agée de 55ans, elle est mariée et mère de famille. MATY évolue dans le commerce de tissus. Elle gère une cantine au niveau du marché et elle a beaucoup de clients. Elle sollicite ce montant pour augmenter son stock de marchandises et satisfaire sa clientèle.  Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. MATY aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes. A l’avenir elle voudrait être pérenne et ne plus avoir besoin des crédits pour faire ses activités et ouvrir un grand magasin pour augmenter et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Maty lives in the district where the UIMCEC branch is located. She is 55 years old, married and a mother. She sells fabric. She runs a small stall at the market and has a lot of customers. She is requesting this loan amount so that she can increase her inventory of merchandise and satisfy her customers. She starts her workday at 8 in the morning and finishes at 6 in the evening. Maty helps her husband with the daily expenditures. In future, she would like to have a sustainable business and no longer need loans to support her activities. She would like to open a large shop and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La señora Susana  de 46  años  de edad, vive con su esposo, tiene 03  hijos que dependen de ella y vive en una comunidad del San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 07  años  a la venta de queso y cuajada.
Doña Susana vende los quesos y la cuajada a las pulpería  y a las personas que tiene comedores, también se dedican a la elaboración de baleadas, su venta es en su casa y los clientes llegan atraer el queso a su casa.
Doña  Susana tiene dos personas que le ayudan en el proceso de la elaboración de los quesos,  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora.
Doña  Susana está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de  leche para cuajar y también para venderla en líquido, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar un poco sus ingresos y también su condición de vida, está muy contenta  de seguir trabajando con Prisma y su deseo es seguir luchando para darle un mejor futuro a su familia, este es su tercer préstamo que solicita.
Doña  Susana su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
Susana is 46 years old and lives with her husband.  They have three dependent children and live in San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras.  She owns her home and has been selling cheese and milk curd for seven years.

Susana sells the cheese and curd to stores and restaurants.  She also makes baleadas and makes all of her sales from her home, to customers who arrive to buy

Susana has two people who help her make the cheeses; she is a hardworking, enterprising woman.

Susana is asking for this loan to buy milk to curdle and also to sell.  She expects this loan to help her improve her income and quality of life a bit.  She is very happy to be working with Prisma and she wants to continue working to provide her family with a better future.  This will be her third loan.

Susana hopes to make improvements to her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2013.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Huriya

texts.ru: Хурия заботливая жена и мать 4 детей. Она имеет золотые руки. Хурия имеет шить женские платья и более 6 лет занимается предоставлением услуги портнихи местным жителям. Она имеет свой швейный цех. Хурия имеет учеников. Она обучает их своим мастерством. Хурия является основной кормилицей семьи, так как доход ее мужа Обиджона не хватает для содержания семьи. Хурия планирует расширить свой бизнес. Она хочет купить швейную машинку, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Huriya is an attentive wife and mother of four children. She has skillful hands. Huriya knows how to sew women's dresses and for more than six years she has provided seamstress services to local residents.  She has her own sewing shop. She also has trainees. She teaches them her trade. Huriya is the main provider for her family, as her husband Obidjon's earnings are not enough to support the family. Huriya plans to expand her business. She wants to buy a sewing machine, but does not have the money. She is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness and relies upon your generosity.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her seamstress business

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Sabaly est un regroupement de femmes mariées du quartier Medina Coura qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles  et ayant en moyenne 36 ans et  4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les médicaments, les condiments, le bois de chauffe, le charbon de bois, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe. 
Aminata  debout en troisième position de la droite vers la gauche compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages aux environs de Koutiala et effectue ses ventes  en détail et en gros,  au comptant et à crédit à la maison  à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabaly comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 120.000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Mme Aminata  compte réaliser  130.000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Sabaly is a group of married women who live in the Medina Coura district and live in extended, traditional families. They have an average age of 36 years and, on average, 4 children. The women in this group sell various items including medicine, condiments, firewood and charcoal. The group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program in order to increase the size of their businesses. This is their 4th group loan.

Aminata, standing 3rd from the right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy some cartloads of firewood. She gets her supplies in the villages surrounding Koutiala and makes her sales retail or wholesale, for cash or credit, to a varied clientèle. While the other Sabaly group members expect to make a profit of 120 000 francs during this sales cycle, Aminata expects to make 130 000 francs. She will use part of her income to pay off her loan, part of it on personal expenditures, and part of it will be used to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Norvin Narciso

texts.es: Norvin es unos de los padres ejemplares, preocupado por el desarrollo intelectual de su familia, es casado con 2 hijos a los que le brinda todo el apoyo  para su desarrollo, actualmente está presentando  una necesidad urgente de un financiamiento, para la compra de equipamiento vestuarios de un hijo para la participación  en las  festividades patrias por ser  uno de los abanderados por su rendimiento académico, esfuerzos que el señor norvin hace como reconocimiento a la abnegación de su esfuerzo en los estudios, por eso llego a ceprodel para solicitar  un financiamiento y lograr  el sueño deseado como todo padre es un orgullo tener hijos con estas cualidades
texts.en:
Norvin is an exemplary father who is concerned about his family's intellectual development. He is married with two children, whose development he fully supports. 

He is currently in urgent need of financing to buy a costume for his son so that he can participate in the national festivals, where he will be a flag-bearer because of his high academic performance. 

Norvin is making this effort in recognition of his son's dedication and effort in his studies. Therefore, he is coming to Ceprodel to apply for a loan and to make his dream come true. Like any parent, he is proud to have children with these qualities.

loans.use: to pay for a flag-bearing costume for his son because he is a student with high academic performance.

loans.name: Fokaben (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Fokaben est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les habits   les chaussures, les produits cosmétiques, les activités de restauration, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de groupe. 
Fanta  est un membre du groupe Fokaben assise à droite de la photo.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs de  chaussures. Elle se procure de ces produits au grand marché. Elle vend ces articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Fokaben comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen 55.000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Fanta  compte réaliser  75.000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Fokaben is a group of married women from the Hamdallaye district of Koutialia town who know each other well and live in extended, traditional families. They are married, have an average age of 34, and have at least 3 children. The women in this group sell various items including clothing, shoes, beauty products and prepared food. The group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program in order to increase the size of their businesses. This is their 10th group loan.

Fanta is the Fokaben group member sitting on the right in the picture. She plans to use her loan to buy several bags of shoes. She gets her merchandise at the Grand Market and sells it for cash, door-to-door or at the market, to a varied retail clientèle. While the other Fokaben group members expect to make an average monthly profit of 55 000 francs each during this sales cycle, Fanta expects to make 75 000 francs. She will use part of her income to pay off her loan, part of it on personal expenditures, and part of it will be used to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
Rosa de 21 años, .tiene un nivel académico hasta el 9º grado, vive junto a su hijo de 2 añitos de edad y su compañero de vida. Se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 4 años; tal trabajo lo aprendió por medio de una amiga, quien gustosamente decidió enseñarle, para poder tener unos ingresos extras en la casa. 

Comercializa ropa para ambos sexos. Para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, que a veces son exigentes con lo que van a comprar. El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para comprar cemento, arena y piedra; para mejorar el área donde esta ubicada su cocina y la otra parte la invertirá en la compra de más ropa.
Con eso ella se verá satisfecha con ver una cocina bonita y adaptable. Además, se complacerá al ver que su negocio crece, cuando ella invierta el dinero.

Ella planea tener un negocio grande, verse convertida en una verdadera comerciante, que le permita poder darle una buena educación a su hijo para su desarrollo social.
texts.en:
Rosa, 21, has a 9th-grade education. She lives with her two-year-old son and her life partner. 

She has made a living selling clothing for four years. She learned about this work from a friend, who gladly decided to teach her about the business in order to have some extra money at home. She sells clothing for both men and women to meet the needs of her clients, who are sometimes very demanding in terms of what they will buy. 

She has applied for a loan to buy cement, sand, and rocks to improve the area of her home where her kitchen is located. She will use the other part of the loan to buy more clothing.

With the help of this loan, she will be satisfied to see a beautiful and adaptable kitchen. She will also be pleased to see her business grow with this investment.

She plans to have a large business and to become a true businesswoman, which will allow her to give her son a good education for his social development.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and rocks to improve the area where her kitchen is located, as well as to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Concentidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONCENTIDAS” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silveria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, venta de comida, venta de enseres electrónicos, tejedora de ajuares de bebe, venta de deportivos, carpintería, venta de artículos de ferretería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silveria es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de productos de  ferretería; da a conocer que este negocio lo adquirió al casarse, ya que su esposo se dedicaba a desarrollar la venta de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de alicates) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y compartir con las compañeras.
texts.en:
The “Concentidas” communal bank is beginning its eighth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes center.  The group is made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors where Silveria serves as president.  The members have different businesses, such as fruit sales, food sales, electronics sales, baby clothes knitting, device sales, carpentry, and hardware sales.

This loan will benefit their small businesses, including Silveria’s.  She has been with Pro Mujer for four years, having joined on the invitation of a promoter who visited her in her home.  She sells hardware and says that she acquired this business when she got married, since her husband had been developing it.

She will use the money for this loan to buy pliers at traditional fairs.  She will buy in quantity and then resell them.  This will allow her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes saving money and spending time with her friends.

loans.use: to buy pliers.

loans.name: Juana Benita

texts.es:
Juana tiene 34 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad de chincha,  ciudad conocida por su población de origen afroperuano, por sus danzas y es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, por sus hermosas playas y por la producción de nuestro producto Bandera el “Pisco”, también esta ciudad es muy conocida por su comida ya que los pobladores de esa ciudad se les conoce por la buena sazón que tienen, uno de los platos favoritos de Juana es el riquísimo arroz con pato, Juana estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres.

Juana se dedica a la venta de Ropa y Zapatillas, es muy luchadora y sobre todo responsable, ella se levanta desde muy temprano para poder hacer sus quehaceres del hogar temprano y irse a trabajar, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy constante, por la calidad de sus productos y porque brinda facilidades de pago a sus clientes.

Juana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería, en especial productos de temporada, con ello mejorara su negocio ya que tendrá más variedad de productos para ofrecer y podrá tener más ingresos para seguir ahorrando y poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Ser una empresaria Exitosa”.
texts.en:
Juana, 34, lives in the city of Chincha. This city is known for its Afro-Peruvian population, for its dances, for being the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes, and for its beautiful beaches. "Pisco", Peru's flagship product, is also produced here. The city is also very well-known for its food, as the inhabitants of this city are known for their good seasoning. One of Juana's favorite meals is the delicious duck rice. Juana studied up until the fifth grade of secondary school due to her parents' limited financial resources.

Juana makes a living selling clothing and slippers. She is a fighter and a very responsible woman. She wakes up very early to take care of her household duties and go to work. She works for about 8 hours per day and she can serve about 15 clients in one day. She believes that her business is going well because she is very consistent, because of the quality of her products, and because she offers her clients payment facilities.

Juana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support, she will be able to buy more merchandise, especially seasonal products. She will then improve her business because she will have a greater variety of products to offer. She will also have more earnings so that she can keep saving to make her greatest dream come true: to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Shohista

texts.ru: Шохиста женщина с огромным жизненным опытом. Она много лет назад потеряла своего мужа. Ее муж умер, когда детям было 5 и 7 лет. Она вырастила своих 2 детей сама. Шохиста всегда упорно работала для того, чтобы зарабатывать достаточно денег. Шохиста пережила много тягости жизни. Она 8 лет назад начала свой бизнес выпечкой и продажей тортов. Шохиста готовит разнообразные торты и пирожные. Она должна проводит мероприятие, но не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы купить продукты питания и пригласить гостей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для проведения мероприятия. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shohista is a woman with a lot of life experience. Many years ago, she lost her husband. Her husband died when her children were 5 and 7 years old. She raised her two children by herself. Shohista always worked hard in order to earn enough money.  Shohista survived many difficulties in life. Eight years ago, she started her own business baking and selling cakes. Shohista bakes a wide range of cakes and pastries. She has to host an event but she does not have enough money to buy food products and invite guests. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 USD to host an event. She awaits your kindness and relies upon your generosity.

loans.use: To host an event.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана живет в селе в своем доме вместе с мужем и двумя детьми. Светлана работает в продуктовом магазине, муж работает охранником на зернохранилище, дети учатся в школе. В данный момент дом, в котором они живут имеет печное отопление, т.е. Светлана с мужем использут уголь и дрова. Это достаточно дорого и не эффективно. Светлана с мужем хотят провести в дом природный газ (магистраль идет по их улице) и приобрести газовый котел. Для этого Светлана просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 20,000 гривен. Отапление природным газом является менее энергозатратным, т.о. Светлана сможет снизить расход энергии и уменьшить затраты своей семьи на отопление в зимний сезон.
texts.en: Svetlana lives a village in her own home with her husband and two children.  Svetlana works in a grocery store. Her husband works as a security guard in a grain warehouse and their children attend school. Currently, the house in which she lives has stove heating, that is to say, Svetlana and her husband use coal and firewood. It is very expensive and ineffective. Svetlana and her husband want to install natural gas in their home (a gas line runs along their street) and acquire a gas boiler. For this reason, Svetlana is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia. Natural gas heating wastes less energy, thus Svetlana will be able to reduce her energy expenses and decrease her family's expenditures on heating in the winter months.

loans.use: to install natural gas heating in her house

loans.name: Jesús Emilio

texts.es: Jesús, a sus 60 años de edad, es casado y padre de 2 hijos. Durante toda su vida productiva se dedicó a trabajar en el área de construcción, pero, debido a la inestabilidad laboral y a su edad, decidió independizarse y, con unos ahorros que tenía, inició su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes donde ofrece productos de aseo, granos, pastas, lácteos y muchos productos de la canasta familiar, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija menor y trabajan desde las 7:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm todos los días; para complementar los ingresos familiares, aún realiza trabajos de construcción esporádicamente, momentos en los cuales recibe el apoyo de su familia para atender su negocio. El cliente manifiesta que su principal desafío es la falta de capital de trabajo, pues el surtido es muy limitado y ha perdido ventas por falta de productos, sin embargo, esto no lo desanima, por el contrario, se motiva para buscar opciones que le permitan seguir con su proyecto. Es por ello que solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará surtido al por mayor (granos, pastas, mecato, gaseosas, carnes frías, lácteos, entre otros), así podrá tener más variedad de productos disponibles para ofrecer a su clientela, mejorando sus ventas y los ingresos, con lo cuales podrá seguir solventando las necesidades básicas del hogar. Jesús sueña con lograr ampliar su tienda, acreditarla con más productos y aumentar su clientela, pues con ello podrá garantizar una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su familia un mejor bienestar y, en un futuro cercano poder disfrutar los frutos de su ardua labor, en compañía de los suyos.
texts.en:
Jesús is 60 years old, married, and the father of two children.  Throughout his entire productive life, Jesús worked in the construction field, but due to the unstable labor market and his age he decided to become independent.  With some savings he had on hand, he decided to start his own business.  Jesús has a grocery store where he offers cleaning products, grains, pastas, dairy products, and many other household products.  He has the help of his young daughter and they work every day from 7:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M.  In order to supplement his family’s earnings, Jesús also performs construction jobs on a sporadic basis.  During these moments, his family helps with managing the business.  

Jesús says that his main challenge is the lack of operating capital, which limits his inventory and results in lost sales because he lacks products.  Nonetheless, this does not discourage him.  On the contrary, he is motivated to look for ways to move forward with his business.  For this reason, Jesús is requesting a loan so that he can buy merchandise in bulk (grains, pastas, pastries, sodas, cold cuts, dairy products, and other items).  This will enable him to have a wider variety of products on hand that he can offer to his customers.  As a result, he will be able to improve his sales and his income so that he can continue covering basic household needs.  

Jesús dreams of expanding his store, stocking his business with more products, and increasing his clientele.  This will guarantee favorable financial stability so that he can improve his family’s well-being.  In the near future, he would like to enjoy the fruits of his hard labor along with his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy grains, pastas, pastries, sodas, cold cuts, dairy products, and other items in bulk.

loans.name: Alejandra Ines

texts.es: La Señorita Alejandra es estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería en control ambiental en una universidad de la Ciudad de La Paz, ella tiene 22 años de edad, desde muy pequeña mostro inclinaciones a los números y lo que es el cuidado del medio ambiente por este motivo decidió estudiar esta carrera, ella trabaja desde los 19 años atendiendo un café internet,  y también  sus papas pagaban sus gastos de estudio, pero ella decidió sacar crédito en la institución para comprar un computadora que le hace mucha falta para realizar sus trabajos y algunos proyectos,   Y con su  trabajo ella  podrá pagar sus cuotas, ella es una joven responsable su único deseo es poder salir profesional y ejercer su profesión y así ayudar a sus padres a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Alejandra is an environmental engineering student at a university in La Paz.  She is 22 years old and demonstrated an affinity for numbers and a caring for the environment when she was very young, so she decided to study this career.  She has been working at an Internet café since she was 19.  Her parents also helped with her education costs, but she decided to ask for a loan to buy a computer that she desperately needs for her schooling and some other projects.  She will be able to make her payments through her work.  She is responsible and only wants to get ahead professionally and work in her field, so that she can help her parents have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Aida Betina

texts.es:
La Señora Aida vive en un barrio de  la ciudad de El Paraíso, junto a sus 3 hijos, es madre soltera y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumería dichos productos los ofrece por catalogo, tiene 25 años de realizar esta actividad.
Doña Aida sale a vender de manera ambulante en los diferentes barrios y colonias de la ciudad, donde ya tiene clientes que la prefieren y le encargan más de su producto, también vende en su casa de habitación, ha sabido ganarse a sus clientes por su amabilidad y buen trato, es una persona responsable con deseos de superarse.
Doña Aida también se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, zapatos nuevos para damas, está solicitando el préstamo porque quiere poner una sala de belleza en su casa que la manejaría junto a su hija y en la cual vendería su producto, para lo cual su hija ya tiene experiencia y en este momento no cuenta con el capital requerido para comprar la silla y la champucería.
Doña Aida este es  uno de sus deseos establecer su negocio fijo en su casa, ya no quiere vender de forma ambulante.  


 Danlí, Honduras - Agosto 2013
texts.en:
Aida lives in one of the neighbourhoods of the town of El Paraíso with her three children, whom she raises on her own. She has been selling cosmetics and perfumes out of a catalogue for 25 years. She sells both door-to-door, in various neighbourhoods of her city, where she has loyal customers who order from her time and time again, and at her home. She attributes the loyalty of her customer base to her amiability and pleasant attitude. Aida is a responsible person who wants to always do her best. She also sells clothing, both used and new, as well as new shoes for women. She asks for the loan in order to set up a beauty salon at her house, which she would manage with her daughter and which would help her sell her wares. The daughter has experience in being a beautician but lacks the capital to buy the chair and the shampoo station. One of Aida's goals is to have a business in her house, since she dislikes selling door-to-door.
Danlí, Honduras - August 2013

loans.use: to buy a chair and a shampoo station to start a new business.

loans.name: David Enrique

texts.es:
David vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia, trabaja como empleado en una aserradora de su ciudad, trabaja con él puede obtener los ingresos para poder solventar los gastos, para poder tener un ingreso extra logro iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, en el cual ya lleva algunos años; David cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y lucha para poder salir adelante.

David está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá implementar de mejor manera su negocio, ya que comprara vitrinas, comprar mercadería, entre otros; así el podrá atender mejor a sus clientes y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño: “Ser un gran microempresario”.
texts.en: David lives in the town of Aguaytia and works in a local sawmill as an employee. His income is enough to pay for household expenses, but he wanted to have something extra, so he managed to start a small grocery shop some years ago. David attributes his success to his will to get ahead. He is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, he will be able to improve his shop, notably by buying grocery display cases and merchandises, among others. Thus, he will be able to offer a better service to his customers and to improve his income, so as to keep fighting to make his greatest dream come true: "I want to become a successful small entrepreneur".

loans.use: to buy grocery display cases and merchandise.

loans.name: El Nazareno Group

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 57 años de edad, esta casada y vive con su esposo en la comunidad de la Masica, Atlántida.  Ella tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos como cremas, lociones, champú  etc. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante y por catálogos. Ha obtenido varios préstamos  para mantener activo su negocio, actualmente ha solicitado  otro de forma grupal y es por 7,000 Lempiras con el cual  va comprar cosméticos para vender e incrementar las ganancias y poder lograr un mejor estilo de vida.  El grupo a que pertenece se llama El Nazareno y lo forman los tres: doña María a la izquierda de blusa cuadriculada rosada, en medio  Roberto y a la derecha de falda roja esta Sandra. Roberto vende ropa interior y Sandra vende pescado y cosméticos. Todos son vecinos de la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es por 17,000 lempiras y lo utilizaran para surtir sus negocios para aumentar las ventas.
texts.en: María is 57, married, and lives with her husband in the village of La Masica, in Atlántida. She has been selling cosmetics out of a catalogue for 4 years. Among the products she sells door-to-door are moisturisers, lotions, and shampoos. She took out many loans in the course of her life to keep in business. The one she asks for now, to the tune of 7,000 lempiras, is backed by a borrower's group and will be used to buy cosmetics to sell, in order to increase her profits and have a higher standard of living. The group is called 'El Nazareno' and is comprised of 3 members: María, on the left, wearing a checquered pink blouse, Roberto, standing in the middle, and Sandra, on the right, wearing red trousers. Roberto sells underwear and Sandra fish and cosmetics. They are neighbours. The group loan of 17,000 lempiras will be used to buy more inventory for their respective businesses and increase their sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Jesicah's Group

texts.en:
58-year-old Jesicah has a primary school education and lives in a house with mud walls and a dirt floor in Mwembe B village in Kenya. She has lived in Mwembe B for 37 years with her husband and 6 children.

The community of Mwembe B village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Mwembe B’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination.  

In Mwembe B, 17 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Jesicah has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are also four other promoters that are part of this group loan: Monicah, two Kennedys, and Gladys. Each promoter will be responsible for encouraging people to treat their water using the dispenser, and each of their communities will have access to safe water using a portion of this loan.

Jessicah's village, Mwembe B, along with Monicah's, Gladys' and the Kennedys' villages need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispensers. Jesicah believes that the dispenser will help her community fight waterborne diseases for a healthier lifestyle. She believes water is life. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the five communities, through the sale of carbon credits.  Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that these communities can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine is 35 years old and has 3 children. She lives in Kapkoi village in Kipchekwen, Kenya. Kapkoi village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from an unprotected Spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Josephine and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Josephine works as a peasant farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Josephine and other promoters in her community - Mildred, Milicent, Erika, and Hudson need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Josephine and the other promoters in the group will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Josephine wants to be a promoter because she was chosen and is willing to serve her community. She believes that the dispenser will help people drink clean water.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Josephine’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Milka's Group

texts.en:
In Museywa village in Kipchekwen, Kenya, Milka has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. She is a trustworthy, well-liked member of the community with 6 children who are 34 years, 32 years, twins aged 27 years, 24 years and the last born is a 21 year old. She has lived in Museywa Village for 36 years with her husband and children. 

Museywa village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Milka and the 15 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Milka has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: John, Ezekiel, Catherine, and Jane. 

Milka volunteered to be the promoter because she is grateful that her community will be able to access safe drinking water for free. Her children suffered from diarrheal diseases when they were young and she doesn't want her grandchildren and other children in the village to suffer the same way. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of these five communities, through the sale of carbon credits.  Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Milka’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne, a friendly, hardworking, reliable and trustworthy lady, lives in Jamingo village in Kapchekwen, Kenya with her husband, 2 children and a friend of the family.

The community of Jamingo village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Jamingo’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination.  

In Jamingo, 26 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Everlyne has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. She is motivated to be a promoter to protect her 2 children who are under 5 years from diarrheal diseases to make sure they have a healthy and bright future. There are four other promoters who are part of this group loan: Emily, Ezekiel, Consolata, and Rose.

Jamingo village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Everlyne’s and the other four promoters' communities can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water.

loans.name: Zacharia's Group

texts.en:
Zachariah is a hardworking man who sells bricks in Kenya. He lives in house with mud walls and a dirt floor in Givigoi village in Ivona, Kenya with his wife and 4 children.

The community of Givigoi village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Givigoi’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination.  

In Givigoi, 9 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Zachariah has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. The four other dispenser promoters that are part of this loan are Ephraim, Tende, Samwel, and Joram. Each promoter has volunteered to support the dispenser's operation.

Givigoi village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Zachariah believes that the dispenser will help his community drink safe water which will prevent waterborne diseases and also encourage good hygiene.  

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits.  Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Zachariah’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Las Caprichosas Group

texts.es:
Las caprichosas está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación en la que se encuentra cada una de las integrantes, son de la ciudad de Luque, todas ellas tienen un gran ánimo de lucha, y se están esforzando al máximo para poder lograr sus objetivos.
Cynthia es una de ellas, quien en su encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que hay muchos puntos que debe mejorar y esforzarse mucho.  Ella vende bebidas y comestibles, y con estas actividades es que está teniendo los medios para poder ayudar a su familia, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha y quiere seguir mejorando cada día.
La Sra Cynthia solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, panificados, carne, conservantes,  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Caprichosas" group is currently undergoing the poverty elimination survey, in order to establish the personal situations of each of the members.  All of the members are from the city of Luque and all have a great fighting spirit, and are putting in the maximum effort in order to achieve their goals.

Cynthia is one of the members.  According to the poverty elimination survey, she is at level one, meaning that there are many points that she needs to improve and where she needs to put in a lot of effort.  Cynthia sells drinks and consumable goods and, with this work, she has the means to be able to help her family.  She is very hard-working and feisty, and wants to continue to improve every day.

Cynthia is applying for this loan in order to buy drinks, baked goods, meat, and preservatives.  This will help her to make her business plan a reality, which will help her to improve her income.
