loans.use: to buy drinks, baked goods, meat, and preservatives.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a 49-year-old married woman with five children and two grandchildren. She is a trained nurse and was working for the Catholic Church mobile clinics in her parish up to 2008, when she was laid off due the harsh economic conditions prevailing in Kenya at that time. 

She started a retail shop dealing with household consumables in mid 2008 and registered the business in 2009. She later diversified into cereals trading due to the minimal profits from the household items. 

Penina was introduced to the solar lanterns, which can provide safe lighting and come with a mobile charging function by our green energy marketing team. Because of the recurring high cost and health effects associated with paraffin, which is the commonly used lighting fuel around her remote area, she saw an opportunity to boost her sales, increase productivity and raise the living conditions of people in the community. She appreciates the benefits accruing from the use of solar lanterns, and with the Kiva financing option from Brazafric, she is seeking financing to purchase solar lanterns for stocking and reselling to her community. 

Penina points out that she would buy some solar lanterns for her grandchildren to ease and increase their study sessions and also for her shop to increase her working hours.

loans.use: TO BUY SOLAR LANTERNS.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr:
Mr WENDINMI représente le groupe ESPOIR. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 06ans et le 03ans. 01 va à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charge.
Il vend de produits de beauté depuis 02ans. Il s’approvisionne  au grand marché. Ses clients  sont les  hommes et les femmes.
Mr veut s’acheter 04douzaines de parfuns, 03douzaines de produits de beauté.
IL  désire épargner ses bénéfices. Il ambitionne agrandir son activité et s’acquérir une moto.
texts.en:
Wendinmi represents the Espoir ("hope") group. He is married and the father of 2 children. His oldest child is 6 years old, and the younger child 3 years old. One of his children attends school, and Wendinmi has 4 people in his care. He has been selling beauty products for 2 years. His customers are both men and women.

Wendinmi would like to purchase 4 dozen perfumes and 3 dozen beauty products. He hopes to save his profits. His dream is to grow his business and to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase 4 dozen perfumes and 3 dozen beauty products

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has been a potato grower for the past twenty years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use in potato production. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in potato growing for better output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use in potato productions.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es  productor de leche el cual  entrega a una empresa de acopio,  recientemente falleció su esposa razón por la cual vive junto a su hija y su nieta a la cual el los mantiene su comunidad Nina Chiri se encuentra en el municipio de Laja a dos   horas de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche, la que diariamente entrega al recolector. Sus nieta se  encuentra en edad escolar, razón por la cual requieren mayores recursos para solventar sus gastos
.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar una vaquilla la cual a lo futuro se convertirá en una vaca en producción

El sueño de Francisco es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado.
texts.en:
Francisco is a producer of milk, which he hands to a gathering company. His wife passed away recently, and so he lives together with his daughter and his granddaughter, both of whom he provides for. 

His community Nina Chiri is located in the Laja municipality, two hours from the city of La Paz. He has a number of cattle that provide him with milk, which he hands over to the gatherer on a daily basis. His granddaughter is of school age, which is why he needs more resources to cover for the expenses.

He is requesting this loan in order to buy a heifer that will eventually become a dairy producing cow.

Francisco's dream is to increase his number of cattle.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha por su familia, esta trabajando duro para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener, con ayuda de su Esposo Gilberto esta saliendo adelante. El crédito aneterior de Kiva lo utilizo en la compra de azúcar, guayaba, miel, etc, y con ello pudo seguir trabajando.
Hoy solicita un nuevo crédito para poder comprar los mismos insumos (azúcar, guayaba y miel) y así poder ofrecer gran variedad de dulces Caseros a sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a very hard-working person who always strives to give her family everything that she did not have herself. With the help of her husband, Gilberto, her family is getting ahead. Lorenza used the previous Kiva loan to buy sugar, guava, honey and other ingredients to continue making jam.

Lorenza is requesting this loan to buy the same ingredients (sugar, guava and honey) to make jam. She hopes to offer a larger variety of home-made jams to her customers. Lorenza says that she is thankful for the loan, which will be a big help to her.

loans.use: To buy sugar, guava, honey and other ingredients in bulk to make jam.

loans.name: Momela (Two) Group

texts.en:
Muhsin, who is in his early 30s, is married with one child who is going to school.  He has been running two different businesses: managing a bajaji (three-wheel motorcycle) for three years and managing a retail shop selling food items since 1999. Muhsin works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is his 4th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his bajaji and replace out of stock shop foods. He has paid back all his previous loans successfully. With the business profit earned he bought a TV, sofa set, fridge, digital decoder and covered household and school expenses. 

Muhsin will use this loan to buy more stock for the retail shop. He dreams to open another shop. He will share this loan with his loan group "Momela (Two)" which consists of seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the retail shop.

loans.name: Megi

texts.en:
Megi is 29 years old. She is married and lives in the Kobuleti district with her husband and eight-year-old son. The source of income for Megi is her newly started store, selling secondary furniture. It has been a profitable project, but it also needs more support to develop further. Several times, she has asked for loans from local financial institutions to develop her business, but without success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income. Megi’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with credit with soft conditions to the vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Megi will purchase more furniture that customers often request. She plans to increase the turnover in her trade business gradually. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Megi will work hard, and she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family. With this loan, her family will generate enough income to access regular available credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event that they need it.

loans.use: to purchase more furniture for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her son’s university tuition fee

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 26 years old and he lives in Gaza. His life conditions prevented him from completing higher education, so he decided to open a barber shop, before four years he got course in this field.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a barber chair and air condition for his shop. This will increase the number of clients, and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a barber chair and air condition for his shop.

loans.name: Tofasi

texts.en:
Tofasi is single with no child. She has no additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes on a retail basis. She takes care of additional family members. She sells her clothes from door-to-door basis. She has been in business for 1 year. She gets additional income from dry cleaning, which she operates from home. She works six days a week.  

She has applied for a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more secondhand skirts and blouses. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season), which hinders her movements and transportation. She is aspiring to get a permanent residence. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 34 years old, and she resides in the surrounding community of Airport. She is married, and has seven children between 2 to 19. Only six are in currently attending school and living at home. 

For the past five years, she been selling slippers in the local market. A problem she faces is the rainy season. 

She started this business by selling for her mother and later established her own business. She sells six days a week, spending eight hours each day on her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase slippers for her business.

Her plan is to build a house. She likes to thank the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase slippers for her business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 40 years old. He lives with his mother in a small village in the Tskaltubo district. 

The family runs an animal husbandry business. Specifically, they have four cows. His mother milks the cows every day and produces cheese for selling. In addition, his mother sells flowers.

Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, George was unable to study a professional career. George decided to start his own business, and seek credit among local financial institutions; his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application for a loan of $5,000 to build a greenhouse was approved under the framework of this program. 

He will purchase the building materials, and tomato and cucumber seeds. As the greenhouse is built, he will sow vegetables and will sell the harvest at a good price. 

The new business initiative will give him chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Balasan

texts.en:
Balasan is from Sardarapat village in Armavir region. She is a devoted mother of two daughters. Balasan's husband works at a local company and gets a salary which is hardly enough to cover the family's daily costs. So, in order to tackle her financial hardships, Balasan runs a farm. Their daughters are students. The elder one, Hasmik, studies at Yerevan State Medical University after M. Heratsi and is now in her first year of study. As it is very difficult for Balasan and her husband to save money for Hasmik's education and at the same time to save money for the family's living, Balasan has applied for this loan. The loan will greatly assist her in paying for Hasmik's university tuition, allowing her to continue her education.

Balasan and her whole family hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 50 years old, and she lives in the community surrounding Airport. She did not attend school and has five children between the ages of 20 and 31 years old. Only the youngst one is in school, and they all live at home.For the past ten years  she has been selling red oil, vita, pepper, onion, beans, and other items in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her fiancee, and she learned trading from her friends. She likes how her business makes her independent. She spends ten hours on her business every day from Monday to Saturday. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, vita, pepper, onion, beans, and other items for her business. She hopes to build her own house. She is glad to be a borrower with BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, vita, pepper, onion, beans, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 31 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Ana Marie works very hard to provide for them.

Ana Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Ana Marie has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Ana Marie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
Deisy es miembro de una familia humilde, su madre se encuentra trabajando en España ayudándoles desde allá para el sustento del día a día de la familia.
Deisy está estudiando la carrera de Fisioterapeuta y Rehabilitación, y comenta que su principal objetivo es terminar  su carrera y conseguir un trabajo formal donde pueda aumentar sus ingresos y llagar a tener una mejor calidad de vida, y también poder ayudar a las personas que necesitan atención en su salud.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de transportación y también en poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Deisy is a member of a modest family. Her mother is currently working in Spain, helping to support her family from abroad in its daily expenses. Deisy is studying Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation at a university. She says that her main goal is to finish her degree and obtain a formal job that will help her to increase her income. In this way she hopes to improve her quality of life while also helping those who need special attention when it comes to their health. 

Deisy is requesting this loan in order to pay the cost of transportation to her university as well as to invest in her tuition. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for classes and transportation.

loans.name: Artesanas De Ñanduti Group

texts.es:
Las 14 integrantes de este grupo son mujeres muy sacrificadas, que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación están saliendo adelante, son un ejemplo por el esmero que ponen, ya que quieren capacitarse para poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia.  Todas y cada una de ellas están muy agradecidas por esta oportunidad de crecer que están recibiendo.
La señora Lisia, es parte de este grupo, está casada , tiene 37 años, ella es la presidenta del comité, y comenta que siempre trata de instar a sus compañeras a seguir trabajando. Tiene una despencita, en la que trabaja todos los días y pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en verduras y carne, aceite, etc para surtir su almacén y seguir dando a su clientela todo lo que piden.
texts.en:
The 14 members of this group are self-sacrificing women, who through a lot of effort and dedication are getting ahead. They are an example for their diligence, as they wish to empower themselves to improve the lives of their families and their own as well. Each one of them is grateful for this opportunity to grow that they are receiving.

One of the members, Lisia, is 37 years old and is the President of the Board of Directors. She says that she always tries to encourage her companions to continue working. She has a small store where she works every day. Lisia is asking for this loan to invest it in buying vegetables, meat, oil, etc. to stock her business and continue providing her clients with what they desire.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, oil, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel, es un grupo con ganas de crecer e ir mejorando, está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Yasy Cañy, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica de Curuguaty y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Ramona es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su pequeño negocio de una Despensa, en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, luchando por tener los ingresos y de esa forma poder dar a su familia para el día a día. Cuenta que al principio le fue muy difícil, pero que ha ido creciendo. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de verduras, comestibles, lácteos, productos en suelto y demás,  para su despensa  Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
San Miguel is a group with a strong desire for growth and improvement.  They are in cycle #2 in the women’s committee program.  It’s from the city of Yasy Cañy, a zone that’s a bit far from Curuguary’s central zone but even so it’s in a growth phase.  It’s a zone that’s difficult to access so the group members want to strive to continue growing and to create a better environment to the zone they live in and to continue growing slowly. 

Ramona is one of the members.  She has a small grocery store where she works every day starting at the very early hours of the day striving to earn income to provide for her family’s daily needs.  She comments that it was very difficult at first but that she’s been growing.  She hopes that as time passes and by means of all the people in her zone, they will be able to continue improving the environment to offer better security for their families and also to secure better futures for them.

She’s asking for this loan to buy vegetables, foodstuffs, dairy products, bulk items, etc. for her store to continue to grow in business and to give her family what they need to have a life that’s free of want.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, dairy products, loose items and others.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia es una joven de la ciudad de Paraguarí, que tiene muchos sueños y metas, y comenta que su principal anhelo es poder graduarse como Licenciada y ejercer su carrera, que es la de psicología.
Quiere poder tener un buen puesto en algún hospital, ayudar a las personas y por supuesto a su familia. Ella estudia mucho para poder ser la mejor en lo que hace y seguir así estando cada vez más cerca de cumplir su meta.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases de la universidad, y así poder cubrir lo que surja. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Leticia is a young woman from the city of Paraguarí who has many dreams and goals, and says that her main desire is to graduate with a degree and pursue a career in psychology. 

She would like to have a good position in a hospital, helping people, and of course, helping her family. She studies hard to be the best at what she does and continues to strive for this goal. She is applying for this loan in order to pay for her university classes and to be able to cover any costs that may arise. She is grateful for this opportunity, which will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay for university classes

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su cuarto ciclo del programa de comités, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, la cual es una zona no muy alejada de la zona céntrica y se encuentra en crecimiento, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Ubaldina es una de las integrantes, ella es de un barrio de Curuguaty donde tiene su pequeño negocio de Verdulería y heladería, y por medio de su trabajo esta ayudando a su familia, dándoles lo que necesitan para el día a día. Es una persona muy luchadora y emprendedora. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Retiro este crédito para la compra de verduras y para ampliar su heladería, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Unidas" ("United Women") group is in its fourth cycle of the committee program. The group is from the city of Curuguaty, which is not too far away from the central zone. This area is growing, and the group members want to fight to grow and to give their area a better atmosphere to continue growing gradually.

Ubaldina is one of the members of this group. She is from a neighborhood in Curuguaty where she has a small business selling vegetables and ice cream. Through her work, she is helping her family and providing them with their day-to-day necessities. She is a fighter and an enterprising woman. She says that as time goes by and with the help of everyone in the area, they can improve their surroundings and offer their families better security and a better future.

She has applied for a loan to buy vegetables and to expand her ice cream shop. She will then be able to continue growing her business and thus give her family everything they need to live free from hardship.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell and expand her ice cream shop.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.es:
Leonida está cursando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, vive en casa de su madre. Ella es el sostén de la familia, y comenta que aspira a recibirse de Licenciada y cursar después la carrera de Ingeniería.
El crédito será de mucha ayuda para poder lograr sus objetivos e invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas. Actualmente está trabajando en una empresa en la zona de la ciudad trabajando y luchando. Desea en un futuro ser una gran profesional y formar una gran familia.
texts.en:
Leonida is studying for a degree in Business Administartion.  She lives at her mother’s house.  Leonida says that she is the breadwinner in her family and aspires to receive her degree.  After she is finished, she would like to study for another degree in Engineering.

This loan will be of great help because it will help her to achieve her goals and invest in the payment of her fees.  She is currently working for a company in the city.  In the future, she would like to be a successful professional and have a large family.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Gervais

texts.en:
Gervais is 40 years old. He is a father of four children, aged between 1 and 10 years; only three go to school. His wife works in a public institution. He has been a potato grower for the past 10 years. Gervais has requested the loan to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the potato production will be used to reinvest in the same produce for a better future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Anna requested a 1,800 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Anna is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 53 years old. He is a father of seven children and they all go to school. 

With the loan, Isaac will buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use in the production of potatoes. He plans to use the profits for paying school fees for his children and providing the basic requirements for his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use during the production.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Jenneh is 38 years old and lives in Margibi County, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She and her fiancé live together along with their 16-year-old child, who is in school. Her fiancé is a policeman. 

She did not attend school but she has been good at managing her business for over ten years now. She described herself as a hardworking woman. She received a little money from her fiancé to established her business, and she enjoys her business because she makes more profits and has more customers.

She sells for ten hours each day, six days a week at her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more rubber dishes (bowls, pans, plates, buckets, etc.) for her business. Her plan is to increase her business even more. She likes to say thanks to the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more rubber dishes (bowls, pans, plates, buckets, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en:
Khom is 43 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Rice farming and cassava planting are the primary sources of her family’s income, and she has been in this business for 25 years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 38,000 KHR per day and save about 20,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

This is the first micro loan for Khom with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Khom will use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to give maintenance to his vehicle.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 37 years old, married, and supports a family of six. His children are aged between fourteen and six years old.

Joseph is a carpenter in Bomet and has been in the business for the last 13 years, earning an income of approximately Kes 30,000 a month.

In the quest of business diversification and offering after-sales service to his customers, Joseph has decided to acquire a motorcycle for transport. It's for this reason that he has applied for his first loan with Kadet of Kes 90,000 buy the motorcycle for transport.

He will use the proceeds to boost his savings account. His dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Rohyati

texts.en:
The story of Junita, daughter of Rohyati:

I love Social Knowledge, because I like to study history. By learning history, I know the history of my nation and also other nations around the world. I have a little trouble about the way to school and to go home. If I go home rather late, it’s hard to find public transportation so I walk instead. My hometown is far from school but I have no choice. Having new friends and teachers makes me glad. 

As a Moslem, I spend my spare time learing more about the Qur’an and other knowledge about Islam. I can manage my time well, for study and extra-curricular activities. We rent a house because we have not had our own house yet. I usually go to school on foot, but if I wake up late, I go by bus. I am afraid the gate of my school will be closed. 

To KIVA lenders, I am very grateful. Your help is useful for me. I live in Jeruklegi Wetan Village, Jeruklegi Subdistrict, Cilacap Regency, Mid Java Province, Indonesia. The condition of my village is not modern, The road is mud and soil, with many trees and hilly. My parents earn money from their small business. Their salary is not fixed; it is about Rp. 700,000/month.

 The number of children in my family is three. They are: me / the oldest ( 15 years old ), Rizal ( 9 years old ), and Lutfi ( 4 years old ). Only me and my younger brother,  Rizal, are students. With this loan I can lighten the financial burden of my family. In this school, I learn accounting as my major. To be a good and successful accountant is my dream. It is a pleasure for me to learn new knowledge that I haven’t learned before.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Ineza

texts.en:
Ineza is 53 years old from the village of Nagomari. She is a mother of two grown children who are students and live in the capital city separately. Ineza lives with her husband and her mother-in-law. 

They are running an agricultural business and grow maize and nuts on the family-owned plot of land. Besides, Ineza has a dairy cow and sells cheese products locally. Unfortunately, the existing income is not enough to make ends meet for the family. So Ineza decided to start a trading business with a loan. But the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Ineza’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfy their requirements. 

She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Startup Program gives vulnerable poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of 3,600 GEL, she will purchase second-hand clothing and shoes at wholesale prices and sell it in her community. She will set up a store and offer her customers a wide assortment and well-priced products. Ineza has got the several useful recommendations from a relative who is running the same business and hopes her project will be lucrative. She plans to develop her trading business gradually. The startup credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stock of used clothing and shoes for starting a store.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is single with one child who goes to school. She has no additional family members. She resides in her own house and the family has access to neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family. 

She operates a beauty salon from home. She has been in business for six months. She works seven days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 100,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy hair treatments, weaves, relaxers and braids. Her major business challenges include electricity, lack of which hinders her business operations. She is aspiring to get a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more hair treatments, weaves, relaxers and braids.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is an honored musician from Yerevan. He plays the Armenian national "duduk" and is also specialized in playing the saxophone. Suren performs with many famous musicians who greatly value his professionalism. 

Now, this talented musician needs financial support for getting bagpipes. Suren's income doesn't allow him to save money and purchase that instrument which will give him an opportunity to expand his repertoire. Suren has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, this loan is very important for Suren to be able to purchase bagpipes and continue his beloved work.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing bagpipes

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 36 years old, single with three children between the ages of 14 and 21. Only one is in school and they all are living at home in the Airport area, one of the most best-known places in Mirgibi County. Comfort is an eighth grade dropout and has been selling used clothes in the local market over the past ten years. She uses a taxi most of the time to bring her goods to the market.  She really faces problems during the rainy season because she does not have a good selling spot in the local market. 

Comfort is requesting a loan to increase her sales by buying more used clothes. Her dream is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to increase her sales by buying more used clothes.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 25 years old. He is married and has one son. He lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbed. Mohammad has been selling coffee and tea for four years. His project is profitable as it is a good source of income for his family. He is planning to add new drinks and snacks to his project to raise his sales and earn better income, but he doesn't have enough money to buy them. For this reason, he applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To add new drinks and snacks to his project

loans.name: Seat's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Tbaung Khum district of Kampong Cham province, Seat is aged 43 years and married. She has four children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and working as paid workers in the local area. The current business earns her family about 15,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Seat is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Seat is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза является повторной клиенткой и имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Ей 22 года. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Шахноза является студенткой 5 курса Таджикиского Технологического Университета. Она учится успешно. Шахноза учится в очное отделение по договорной основе. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shahnoza is a returning client with a good credit history. She is 22 years old. She is married without children. Shahnoza is a 5th-year student at the Technological University of Tajikistan. She is a high-achieving student. She is a day student not receiving tuition assistance.  She needs to pay tuition but lacks the necessary funds. Shahnoza is applying for a loan to cover her university tuition. She is counting on your kindness and hopes for your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for her university studies.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 55 years old. She is married and has seven children between 9 and 32 years old. All her children go to schools. 

With the loan, she will buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the potatoes provide food for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use during production.

loans.name: Nayei's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Nayei is a 29-year-old married mother of two children who are dependent on her and still in school. 

Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for several years and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet family’s needs.

Nayei is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to request a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice Mokeira has been running a video entertainment business and has been in the business four years. Her business has been doing well and she has been able to attract clients, most of whom are youth.

This marks Beatrice’s fourth business loan from KADET, and she plans to purchase more seats for her video premise. She also has a fruit juice business in Mshomoroni. She hopes to continue using the anticipated profits to expand her business further and to repay back the KADET loan. 

She still hopes to keep expanding and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more seats in her video premise.

loans.name: Africa One Group

texts.en:
Rashid, who is in his early 30s, is married and a father of one baby. Since 2010, Rashid has been managing his living expenses by running a business of secondhand clothes. He starts working from 8:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily, and is able win a very small monthly profit.
 
This will be his 11th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more clothes and has paid back all his previous loans successfully. 

With the profit earned from his business, he bought a bed, TV, radio, mattress, cupboard, and utensils. He also managed to buy a motorbike. Rashid will use this loan to replenish more clothes and shoes to resell. His dream is to open a big clothes shop.
 
He will share this loan with his loan group, Africa One, which has 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish more clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is 28 years old and lives in Gaza with his wife and child.

He opened a small garage in 2009. He specializes in repairing vehicles. This business is the only source of income for his small family. 

Yaser is satisfied with the income of his business, but he needs this youth loan to make glass installation before winter and buy a new repair kit.

Yaser is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new repair kit and make glass installation before winter.

loans.name: Jemal

texts.en:
Jemal is 56 years old and lives in the Khoni district with his son and daughter. Jemal’s son works at the plumbing store as a salesperson and gets a monthly salary. His daughter is a university student. Jemal’s spouse works in Turkey to help  her family members financially. 

Jemal is a construction worker. He works on house renovations and his average monthly income is $240. Their existing income is not enough for a family of three. With this start-up loan, Jemal will purchase a truck and restart a transportation service business. He will carry and transport different things, depending on the needs and requests of his customers in order to generate income. He used to have a truck seven years ago and worked in transportation, so he has the appropriate experience in this field. That is the reason why he hopes the business will be successful and lucrative.

Jemal would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a truck and restart transportation business

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is 31 years old. She is married and a mother of four. Her husband is a government employee and works at a sweets store. Hanan has been supporting her family by selling detergents for two years. She is planning to open her own store in the future to raise her sales and to improve their living conditions. She started her project with a small quantity of goods. Then she started to expand it over time. 

Now she is planning to add new products like air freshener. She also wants to add more detergents to sell, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy new products and more detergents to sell

loans.name: Nofa

texts.en:
Nofa was born in 1969. She is married and a mother of six. One of her sons is in the military and another one is a government employee. Her husband is a retired man. 

Nofa has been working in selling honey for three years. This project was profitable and helped her in supporting her husband and children.  Now she is planning to buy more machines that will help her in making honey and filtering it in order to sell pure honey. This will help her sell honey with better quality and will make her more productive, but she doesn't have enough money to buy the needed machines. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy filtering machines for honey

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is 33 years old, a very industrious farmer. He has been growing potatoes in Olopito area of Narok county, Kenya, for the last four years, getting a monthly income of KES 12,000. He learnt about Kadet from other farmers in his area. With a first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET, he intends to spray his farm with pesticides for better yields.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His dream is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for his pototo farm

loans.name: Wend La Malgda Group

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOUNA représente le groupe WEND LA  MALGDA. Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 28ans et le moins âgé a 11ans. 05 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des céréales  depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de KILWIN. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 03 sacs de 100kg de maïs et 03sacs de mil.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner. Mme ambitionne agrandir son commerce et s’acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Mamouna is the Wend La Malgda group representative. She is doing very well. She is married and the mother of seven children. The eldest is 28 years old and the youngest is eleven. Five of her children go to school and she has four dependents. Mamouna has been selling cereals (grain) for eleven years. She purchases her supplies at the Kilwin market. Her customers are men and women.

She would like to buy three 100-kilogram sacks of corn, and three sacks of millet. Mamouna wants to save the income she earns. She aims to expand her business and purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy three 100-kilogram sacks of corn and three sacks of millet.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en: Luke bought the part for the lathe machine thanks to your help. Now she is back needing your help again, to buy materials/tools needed for her metalworking business.

loans.use: to buy materials/tools for the metalworking lathe

loans.name: Anhar

texts.en:
Anhar is 34 years old and a widow, with three children to support.  She lives in Aden, Yemen. 

She has been selling materials such as incense, perfumes, and recharge phone cards in order to make a living.   After her husband died, she started her business with a bit of capital to provide for her children.   Her business is the main source of her famiy's income, and she tries her best to expand her sales. 

Recently, she would like to expand her business more.   So she has applied for a loan of YER 100,000 from AMB to buy additional recharge phone cards and incense to sell. She hopes to open a retail shop that will increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy additional recharge phone cards and incense to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, who is 46 years old, is married to Pauline and the father of five children whom he supports. 

He has been a potato farmer in the Enooseyia area of Narok county, Kenya, for the past 12 years. His monthly income is KES 25,000.  With a third loan of KES 30,000 from KADET, he plans to purchase farm inputs including pesticides and fertilizers as well as cover some labor costs.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business. His dream is to have a stable business and improve his family's living standards

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pesticides

loans.name: Maria Selena

texts.en:
Maria Selena works hard to support her family.  She is married, and she has a business buying and selling rice grain in the Philippines.

Maria Selena has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell.  She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Maria Selena would like to save money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell

loans.name: Shefa

texts.en:
Shefa was born in 1970. She is married and a mother of four. One of her daughters is married and another one is a government employee. Her husband trades in junk. 

Shefa has been selling blankets from her house for three years. Her project has been a good source of income to her. She is planning to expand it by buying a larger quantity of blankets in order to raise her sales and income to be able to support her family, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets to sell

loans.name: Wuanita

texts.en:
Wuanita lives in West Point. She is 34 years old, and she is single with a 19-year-old child who is in school. For nine years now, she has been selling soft drinks in the local market. She started this business with a "table market" which she learned from her friend. She likes her business because she generates some money every time when she sells. She spends 8 hours at her business each day. 

Wuanita described herself as hard-working woman. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. Her dream is to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en: Afaf was born in 1973. She is divorced and currently lives with her family. Her two brothers are government employees. Afaf has been working at selling housewares for one month. She started this project to be able to support herself after her divorce as it was profitable for her. She is planning to buy a larger quantity of housewares in order to expand her little business. To do so, she applied for this loan as she doesn't have enough money to buy them.

loans.use: To buy more housewares to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like soap, milk, purified water, soft drinks, etc., for her general store. 

Norma has been in this business for 18 years.   She also earns income from fish vending.

Norma has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like soap, milk, purified water, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Kaly I.

texts.fr:
Habitant dans un village situé à environ  30km de la ville principale, Kaly évolue dans le domaine de l’agriculture depuis deux ans. Il travaille de 9h à 19h du soir. Il possède un champ qu’il exploite depuis plus de 2 ans. Il fait du maraichage et veut un crédit afin de pouvoir acheter des semences.
Avec les bénéfices acquis de l’activité, il gère les besoins quotidiens de sa famille et veille aussi à leur éducation.
Monsieur Kaly a comme ambition de faire de l’élevage à grande échelle et de devenir un grand fournisseur à travers la ville.
texts.en:
Living in a village about 30 km from the main town, Kaly has been working in the field of agriculture for two years. He works from 9:00 AM to 7:00 in the evening. He has a field that he's been operating for over two years. He has been growing vegetables and legumes for sale, and would like to use his loan in order to purchase seeds.

With the income he earns from his business, he manages the daily needs of his family and also pays for their education. Kaly has the goal of entering large-scale farming in order to become a major supplier throughout the city.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for the cultivation of his field.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: El señor Gregorio convive con su esposa, tiene un nivel de instrucción primaria, tienen 8 hijos de los cuales 7 estudian, la familia vive en la comunidad de Colomi a orillas del lago más de 20 años. Son agricultores cultivan papa, haba, oca, papaliza, una parte cultivan en terreno de 2 has herencia de parte de sus padres en la misma comunidad, cuentan con cabezas de ganado vacuno 3 lecheras, 3 vaquillas más 1 ternero; Don Gregorio y su esposa hicieron construir una vivienda nueva, por lo que invirtieron todo sus ahorros en esta construcción y les falto dinero para compra de insumos agrícolas abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa, por este motivo solicita préstamo para la compra de dichos insumos agrícolas. Gracias a este préstamo el señor Gregorio podrá desempeñar su actividad agrícola de forma regular.
texts.en:
Gregorio has primary level education and lives with his wife. They have 8 children of whom 7 are studying. The family has lived in the Colomi community on the shores of the lake for more than 20 years. They are farmers and grow potatoes, broad beans, "oca" and "papalisa" [native tubers]. They grow some of their crops on 2 hectares of land which they inherited from their parents in the same community. They have 3 dairy cows, 3 heifers and a calf.

Gregorio and his wife have had a new house built, investing all of their savings in the construction and so they do not have enough money to buy agricultural supplies such as organic fertilizer (chicken manure) and seed potatoes. For this reason they are asking for a loan to buy these agricultural supplies. Thanks to this loan Gregorio will be able to carry on with his farming work as normal.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es: María es madre cabeza de hogar, tiene 4 hijos a los cuales ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Toda su vida ha vivido en el área rural, donde aprendió las labores del campo y gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de café, ganado de levante y cría de cerdos, con esto genera los recursos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Con esmero y dedicación ha sabido sobrepasar diversos obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente con los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas y de los productos veterinarios que requiere para cuidar a sus animales, sin embargo, esto no la detiene, pues con su espíritu emprendedor siempre encuentra la forma de seguir avanzando. Esto la lleva a solicitar el crédito como apoyo para darle continuidad a su actividad, con el dinero comprará terneras de levante y lechones para cría y engorde, para luego venderlos, de esta manera podrá aumentar su producción y mejorará la entrada de recursos económicos al hogar, permitiendo tener la oportunidad de fortalecer su negocio y poco a poco ir logrando una producción escalonada que le garantice recibir ingresos de manera constante, para seguir velando por el bienestar de sus hijos y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María's a mother and the head of her household.  She has four children whom she has gotten ahead with a lot of effort.  She has lived her whole life in a rural area where she learned farm labor.  Thanks to that, today she has coffee crops and cattle and pigs to raise with which she earns the money to pay for her household's basic needs.

With care and dedication María has been able to overcome various obstacles that have come up, especially with the high cost of agricultural inputs and the veterinary products she needs to take care of her animals.  This doesn't hold her back, though, because with her enterprising spirit she always finds a way to continue making progress.

This brings María to request the loan as support for continuing with her job.  With the money she'll buy calves and piglets to raise and fatten for later sale.

She'll be able to increase her production and improve the household income, which will allow her to strengthen her business and stagger production to guarantee that she constantly has money coming in.  This way she can continue to look out for the welfare of her children and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy calves and piglets

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
41-year-old Theresa is from Liberia. She lives in the town of West Point. She is married and has seven children aged between 3 and 24; they all live with her and are attending school. 

For eight years now she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She sells from morning to afternoon time six days of the week. She has a regular group of customers that visit her table for new merchandise among her used clothes. She gives goods on credit to some customers and collects the money later; most interestingly she makes her own money. 

Theresa has requested a loan to purchase more used clothes. In the future, she wants to be her own boss and wants her children to live a good life. She thanks BRAC Liberia for their continuous support.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes.

loans.name: Nadya

texts.en:
Nadia was born in 1972.  She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba. Because Nadia is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture.

Her husband is a retired man who is currently running a cellphone shop that he rented. He has been running it for six years, and Nadia helps him with it. This project has helped them cover their needs, as it has been profitable for them. 

Nadia and her husband are planning to add new products to their project, like mobile-phone accessories and mobile credit cards, in order to attract more customers and raise their sales. To do so, Nadia has applied for this loan to buy them, as they don’t have enough money for them.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories and mobile credit cards to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 29 years old and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has two children, aged 9 and 12, who are presently in school and live at home. Catherine completed 8th grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.  

For the past 3 years, Catherine has been selling frozen chicken in the local market. She sells six days a week, from 8am to 9pm. She likes how fast her customers buy from her. She started this business by selling for her mother. She uses a taxi to get her stock. 

Catherine is requesting a loan to purchase more frozen chicken for her business. She plans to build a house and to educate her children. She'd like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia Microfinance Company Limited.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen chicken for her business.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheikh s’active dans l’agriculture depuis plus de 10 ans maintenant. Il loge dans un petit village situé à environ 30km de la ville principale. Cheikh est un habitué du guichet, car il en est à son quatrième crédit à l’IMCEC. Il fait du maraichage et a besoin d’un renouvellement de prêt afin de pouvoir acheter des semences et de cultiver son champ.
Avec les revenus de son activité, Cheikh peut s’occuper de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille, améliorer leurs conditions alimentaires  et mettre désormais un peu d’argent de coté pour prévoir les imprévus. Il rêve de construire une maison pour mettre à l’aise sa famille.
Comme projet futur il veut exploiter d’autres périmètres culturaux pour maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Cheikh has been active in agriculture for over ten years now. He lives in a small village about 30 km from the main city. Cheikh is a regular at the local branch, as he is on his fourth loan with IMCEC. He has been growing produce for sale, and is in need of a loan renewal in order to buy seeds and cultivate his field.

With the income from his business, Cheikh will be able to take care of the daily expenses of his family and improve their nutrition. He will also put some money aside in case of unexpected expenses. His dream is to build a house for his family to make them comfortable. As a future project he wants to pursue other farming ventures to maximize his income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds so that he can cultivate his field.

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is 22 years old and comes from the Baghdati district. He lives with his wife, parents, two brothers, a daughter-in-law and his grandfather. His grandfather is provided with a retirement pension. Zviad and his brother work at a local petrol station and get a small monthly income. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a vineyard and produce and sell wine. They work hard and always have high quality wine, which is sold to local retailers for a good price. 

 As the family has only seasonal income, Zviad decided to start his own business and seek for credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 2500 Gel.

 With the received credit, Zviad will build a greenhouse. He will purchase building materials and seeds of cucumbers and tomatoes. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased by the kind help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 32 years old and married, with three children, two of whom are in school.

Yvonne earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to pay for laborers' salaries during harvest and to buy new rice seeds.

Yvonne has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries during harvest and to buy new rice seeds.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Thelma works hard to support her family.

She has a 'buy and sell' rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising livestock. Thelma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her  business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 30 years old and a high school graduate. She lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has a three-year-old child. Her child is attending school and living at home.  She described herself as a hardworking woman. 

Over the past three years she has been selling used clothes. She spends six hours each day selling. She likes her business because of the popularity she has achieved over the years. She started this business with money given to her by her mother; she uses a taxi most of the time to buy her goods.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. 

Catherine's  plan is to build a house and become a big businesswoman.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is from Yerevan where he lives with his wife and two little children. A year ago he rented a small booth where he makes different types of shoes for men and women. He works hard to sustain his family's living.

Now due to poor living conditions, Hovhannes isn't able to purchase materials for making shoes. So, he has applied for this loan for help. Hovhannes has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So this loan will be a great support for Hovhannes to be able to purchase leather and other materials for tailoring shoes. Thus, he will be able to earn income and cover his family's living expenses. 

Hovhannes waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for leather and other materials for making shoes by hand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the cutters and to clean the farm.

loans.name: Ana Arely

texts.es: Doña Ana de 33 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, Ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace mas de 10 años, es una persona respetuosa, educada, responsable, y muy servicial, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores donde ella vive, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Ana solicita un crédito un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes,  herramientas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía, para poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her life companion and their three children.  She has been growing corn and beans for more than 10 years.  Ana is respectful, educated, and responsible person who is very service-oriented.  She sells her products in the surrounding neighborhoods near where she lives.  By working in this manner, she is able to cover many of her family’s expenses.  

Doña Ana is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies for corn and bean crops such as seeds, compost, fertilizers, tools, and other items, such as the ones shown in the photograph.  This will enable her to improve her income and the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, tools, and other items.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita works hard to support her family. Warlita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Warlita requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat like wood, paint, bamboo, etc. She has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat like wood, paint, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda is 40 years old, single with an 18-year-old child who is in school and living at home in the West Point area, one of the most populated and best-known markets in Montserrado County that is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. She did not attend school, and has been selling palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc. in the local market over the past three years. 

Finda is requesting a loan to buy more palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc. She uses a taxi most of the time; she really faces problems during the rainy season because she does not have a good selling spot in the local market. She is grateful for her business because she makes more money from her business. Her plan is to build a house for her child.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: El Naranjo Group

texts.es: Marcelo, tiene, 29 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de El Progreso, Yoro. Tiene aproximadamente 20 años  de dedicarse a la agricultura de hortalizas como ser: culantro, perejil, frijoles, maíz, apio, entre otros. La producción es vendida en la misma zona, siendo esta actividad su fuente de ingresos. Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo de forma grupal, el grupo se llama El Naranjo que esta formado por 7 miembros, todos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. El monto total de préstamo del grupo es por 50,000 Lempiras. Este préstamo lo han solicitado para comprar postes y materiales que necesitan   para el  proyecto de electrificación en su aldea  con el fin de poder impulsar el desarrollo en la comunidad y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda Marcelo de camisa cuadriculada, sigue santos, luego José Donaldo, Lucia, José Leonilo, Andrés a la derecha de camiseta verde, y Marvin no salió en la foto.
texts.en: Marcelo is 29 years old and married.  He has two children and lives in a village that is part of the town of El Progreso, in Yoro.  For some twenty years Marcelo has been making a living growing herbs and vegetables, such as cilantro, parsley, beans, corn, and other items.  What he produces, Marcelo sells in the area and this work is a source of income for him.  He is currently applying for a group loan.  The group, made up of seven members from the same community and all working in agriculture, is called "El Naranjo".  The total loan amount is 50,000 Lempira.  The group have applied for the loan in order to buy posts and other materials that they need in order to bring electricity to the village.  The aim of this is to drive development in the community and to improve living conditions.  In the photo, Marcelo is on the left.  Moving along to the right are Santos, José Donaldo, Lucia, José Leonilo, and Andrés.  Marvin was not there when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy posts and other materials to bring electricity to the area.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: María Elsa es una señora que trabaja a diario  para ganarse la vida, ella es viuda desde hace muchos años. Se dedica a vender de manera ambulante en diferentes rutas, espejos, cuadros y camas los cuales elabora con el apoyo de sus hijos. Solicita el crédito para comprar la materia prima como madera, resina, pintura, cal, tornillos, marcos, pega, talco blanco entre otros  que le permitan elaborar sus productos y continuar las ventas al crédito. De esta manera María Elsa mantiene sus gastos principales del hogar.
texts.en: María Elsa works every day in order to earn a living.  She has been a widow for many years.  She makes a living selling, mirrors, frames, and beds, which she makes with her children's help.  María sells on different roads in the city.  María is applying for a loan to buy basic supplies such as wood, resin, paint, lime, screws, frames, glue, talcum powder, and more.  These supplies will allow her to make her products and continue to sell them on credit.  With this María can cover the main household costs.

loans.use: to buy wood, resin, paint, lime, glue, screws, and frames.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Félix casado más de 34 años, tienen 1 hijo dependiente que estudia en nivel secundaria, la familia es humilde viven en la comunidad de Colomi, son agricultores, anualmente tienen ingresos económicos por la venta estacional de papa, haba, oca, como también cuentan con cabezas de ganado vacuno 3 de engorde más 1 lechera. El señor Félix solicita un crédito para construcción de una vivienda económica ya que el ahorro que tenían no les alcanzo por que invirtieron en compra de insumos agrícolas. Por ultimo don Félix y su esposa tendrán una vivienda para vivir cómodamente cerca a su chaco donde también tiene su labor agrícola.
texts.en: Félix has been married for over 34 years and has one son that is still dependent on his parents - he is attending high school.  This is a humble family and, living in the Colomi community, they are farmers.  Every year the family earns money through seasonal sales of potatoes, broad beans, and oca.  The family also has three cows for fattening up, and one dairy cow.  Félix is applying for a loan in order to buy an cheap house.  He has savings but not enough as he invested in farming supplies.  With the house, Félix and his wife will have a home where they can live comfortably and near where they work.

loans.use: to build a home.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 43 years old, married to Richard, and supports a family of six members. Her children are between the ages of seven and seventeen. She is a maize farmer and she has been in the business for the last ten years. Her monthly income is KES 16,000.

 She is currently requesting her first loan from KADET of Kes 30,000 that will facilitate the harvesting of her maize and transporting it to the market. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and develop her plot. Juliet's dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: pay for harvesting, labour, and transport of her produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es una persona muy emprendedora y responsable, vive en casa propia con su familia que está conformada por sus padres y  hermanos, hace varios años se dedica a su propio negocio que es una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clienta por la variedad de productos que tiene y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos de su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: huevos, golosinas, sopas, aceite, refrescos, verduras, etc. para poder abastecer su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This borrower is a very enterprising and responsible person.  She lives in her own home with her family, which consists of her parents and her siblings.  For several years she has been managing her own business, which is a store that is located in her home.  She has many customers because she offers a variety of products at good prices.  With what she earns from her business, she is able to pay for some of the household expenses.  

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise such as eggs, snack foods, soups, oil, soft drinks, vegetables, and other products so that she can restock her business and satisfy the needs of her customers.  She hopes to provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy eggs, snack foods, soups, oil, soft drinks, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas is 53 years old. He is the father of five children. 

He has been a potato farmer for the past five years. He has requested a loan to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the potatoes he produces will be used to help in providing family needs.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for growing potatoes

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is 48 years old and married, and he supports a family of six members. 

He has been a potato farmer in the Mau Narok area of Kenya for the past 18 years, getting a monthly income of KES 33,000. With a third loan of KES 20,000 from KADET, Haron intends to acquire farm inputs and pay for labor for spraying his potato crop.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His dream is to uplift his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for his potato farm

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha was born in 1988. She is married and is a mother of two children. Her husband is in the military. 

Aysha has been selling sheep and their products for one year. She started her business with a small quantity of sheep. Then she expanded it slowly, over time. Her business was a good source of income which is helping her in supporting her husband and children. 

Now, she is seeking to buy more sheep to be more productive and to expand her income. But, she doesn't have enough money to buy them. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more sheep to increase her business productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted groceries wholesale (pulses, pasta, rice, dairy products, eggs and other items)

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 55 years old, is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. She supports the family through the income she earns from selling soft drinks. She began this business five years ago. Her husband runs a business of repairing and selling old watches. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Yen intends to take a loan to increase her working capital so she can buy many kinds of soft drinks for selling. She hope that this will enable her to increase sales. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks for selling at her store.

loans.name: Danaya (Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les condiments, les fruits et légumes, du savon, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe. 
Awa  est un membre du groupe Danaya assise devant de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des savons (pour toilettes, lessives). Elle se procure de ces produits au grand marché de Koutiala avec les ghanéens. Elle vend ces articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle exclusivement féminine. 
Mme Awa  compte réaliser  30.000FCFA de bénéfice mensuel au cours de ce cycle. En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Danaya is an organization of women from Koutiala who know each other well and who live in traditional larger families with their husbands, children, and other parents. They have an average age of 37 years, are married, and have at least 4 children each. The women in the group are in various businesses, including spices, fruits, vegetables, soaps, etc.

In order to increase the size of their businesses, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their second group loan. 

Awa, a member of the Danaya group, is pictured seated in front, on the left hand side. She plans to use her loan to purchase soaps (for bathing and laundry.) She obtains these products in the big market in Koutiala from Ghanaian sellers. She sells them at retail for cash from her house and in the market to a customer base made up exclusively of women. Awa hopes to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA during this loan period.
